commit_message:
Add log-enable to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the log-enable command

The trove command log-enable is now:
    openstack database log enable

Change-Id: Ia5bb395264946f79673970336e4c1f23857bb77d
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-02 08:38:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Yet another 3rdparty repo. OK, I am fine with it.

But you enabled RPM repos, did Ubuntu and then assume that Debian magically works too.

In Debian "nfs-ganesha" exists in 'buster' and some older version got backported to 'stretch-backports' which is version we use in Kolla.

Please do local build and check does it builds at all.'}, {'account_id': 20663, 'date': '2018-01-19 08:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20663, 'date': '2018-01-19 08:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Yet another 3rdparty repo. OK, I am fine with it.
 > 
 > But you enabled RPM repos, did Ubuntu and then assume that Debian
 > magically works too.
 > 
 > In Debian "nfs-ganesha" exists in 'buster' and some older version
 > got backported to 'stretch-backports' which is version we use in
 > Kolla.
 > 
 > Please do local build and check does it builds at all.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-09 07:01:27.000000000', 'message': "[WIP]Report backend state in service list

Currently, Cinder couldn't report backend state to service,
operators only know that cinder-volume process is up,
but isn't aware of if the backend storage device is ok.
Users still can create volume and go to fail over and over again.

This bp propose to get the backend state from driver directly,
operators or management system could query this via service list.

This function will improve the maintenance ability for Cinder.

Change-Id: I561dca3ef7c1901401621bc112389dbd178a907e
Implements: blueprint report-backend-state-in-service-list

commit_message:
Report backend state in service list

Currently, Cinder couldn't report backend state to service,
operators only know that cinder-volume process is up,
but isn't aware of if the backend storage device is ok.
Users still can create volume and go to fail over and over again.

This bp propose to get the backend state from driver directly,
operators or management system could query this via service list.

This function will improve the maintenance ability for Cinder.

Change-Id: I561dca3ef7c1901401621bc112389dbd178a907e
Implements: blueprint report-backend-state-in-service-list

subject: Remove obsolete tempest-lib
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-21 03:26:57.000000000', 'message': 'Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: Ic6eeaf151dcdcc011a4d941d3f605b7dba265f04
'}]
commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: Ic6eeaf151dcdcc011a4d941d3f605b7dba265f04

Yes,the project used by https://blueprints.launchpad.net/kolla/+spec/multi-project-config.But the project default value is also none in kolla-k8s.So I think set a default value is better.Do you think so?'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-01-20 10:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The option is not related to k8s or ansible. Is more, lets say you only deploy one environment, keep the var empty and your files will be read from etc/kolla.

If you have prod and stagging,

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 08:47:00.000000000', 'message': 'Delete project from group_vars

The "project" in group_vars always none.So all containers binds info like
"/etc/kolla//mariadb".There are more than one '/'  between "/etc/kolla" and
service name.

Change-Id: I2b0dcd984975ca356c88475a89199ade85f4662d
'}]
commit_message:
Delete project from group_vars

The "project" in group_vars always none.So all containers binds info like
"/etc/kolla//mariadb".There are more than one '/'  between "/etc/kolla" and
service name.

Change-Id: I2b0dcd984975ca356c88475a89199ade85f4662d

commit_message:
Add force-delete to OSC

This change adds database support for the python-openstackclient
project for the force-delete and cluster-force-delete commands.

The trove command force-delete is now:
    openstack database instance force delete
The trove command cluster-force-delete is now:
    openstack database cluster force delete

Change-Id: I919678ca6b06d3b5762eac1990cc1fbf0e149d7c
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add quota commands to OSC

This change adds database support for the python-openstackclient
project for the quota-show and quota-update commands.

The trove command quota-show is now:
    openstack database quota show
The trove command quota-update is now:
    openstack database quota update

Change-Id: I989b360fd358004e1a2378bdc3a573450baff2f3
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use log debug instead of warning

Setting the default project is merely provided for convenience,
does not need exist project and grant any actual authorization
on it, This shouldn't be a warning.

At the same time, if the log message exposes to the users,
they know the identity authentication has already passed and
the used password is valid, which could be useful to an attacker.
Log warnings is not necessarily as locked down as debug log,
I think this would be fine as a debug log.

Change-Id: I85ed00ad3d08ed52b159d4da1526a006d72d9677

Unfortunatelly there was used socket.AF_INET4 contant which not exists

commit_message:
Fix usage of socket.AF_INET constant in meta.find_best_address

In commit [1] additional check was added to check if checking address
family is IPv4 or IPv6.
Unfortunatelly there was used socket.AF_INET4 contant which not exists
in socket module.
AF_INET should be used instead and this patch fixes this.

[1] Ida5099278363dc4a527bb488c83883a1d2377f6b
Story: 2001475

Change-Id: Ib50422231d23813e3679bf5390ab9b49afec5db7

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: take LOCAL_PREF into account in route comparison

Update the route comparison methods so that LOCAL_PREF
is taken into account first, before an eventual tie
break.

Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control
Change-Id: If5e6b0ab72345245cbb73f19ea9c6ad17e0a807c

commit_message:
Correctly show no data message in Network Topology

Unhid the message on the div so that if there are no networks,
routers, or connected instances it says this instead of a blank
white box

closes bug: #1661350

Change-Id: Id5f86a81125ff91c5824b51ca4a2141cabc2d0c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 13:33:58.000000000', 'message': "Trunks panel: simplify code for easier testing

The crossHide boolean flag was never a necessary part of the trunks
panel. The only downside of not having it is that we expose a data
structure between the step controllers even when that's not needed
(when crossHide previously was false).

Eliminating the if/else simplifies coverage testing in the followup
patch.

Change-Id: Id7b51997b48d2dd91057975c2fcfb2c40c33aa51
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-trunk-ui
"}]
commit_message:
Trunks panel: simplify code for easier testing

The crossHide boolean flag was never a necessary part of the trunks
panel. The only downside of not having it is that we expose a data
structure between the step controllers even when that's not needed
(when crossHide previously was false).

Eliminating the if/else simplifies coverage testing in the followup
patch.

Change-Id: Id7b51997b48d2dd91057975c2fcfb2c40c33aa51
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-trunk-ui

really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which

commit_message:
Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I704d1bfe7c51880c38482667a6e1fcccb8059357

commit_message:
Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

Note: cherry-picked from master at e779167bf5

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I2f1de103595ec502d9b55df42855a6eda1801b75

commit_message:
Test all nodepool files

We now have nl03, loop over all nodepool files so that new files get
automatically tested.

Change-Id: Iddd4afda10a6cb95b7783ab0454c805d8df7313e

commit_message:
adding iSER connector for PPC64

Power architecture supports iSCSI Extensions for RDMA (iSER) protocol.

Change-Id: I819473cf5df6d626fb4e8e60376339afcacbd695

commit_message:
Make multinode fedora gate non-voting

This patchset sets the fedora multinode gate non-voting until outstanding
gate issues are resolved, so they not blocking future patch sets.

Change-Id: I8ad06f5456b83ff3f618032a8ad0212de5e7a2c1
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: Volume-types

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below Volume-types API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/types
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/types/{volume_type_id}

Made changes to unit tests to pass body as keyword argument as wsgi
calls action method [1] and passes body as keyword argument.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py#L997

Change-Id: Ibacf0acd16d3a3210289244fe2b99ebf5c5dd4ec
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

commit_message:
Add license comments of packages to *requirements.txt 

The *requirements.txt includes requirements.txt and 
test-requirements.txt.

And adjust the version numbers according to the global-requirements.txt

commit_message:
Add resize-volume to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the resize-volume command

The trove command resize-volume is now:
    openstack database instance resize volume

Change-Id: If2413a605d294db0b0ee9c7aa49fbb1c929ebcd0
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

Better designed 404 error page

Edited 404.html to make the error page more appealing and the
style now matches the login page.

Change-Id: I491f77d73beacf6d3c6ae2ded3d8cfc0cd8f5cb2

commit_message:
Fix api.keystone.is_cloud_admin/is_domain_admin handling with new policies

Allow an action if no policy exists for it and there is no default
policy.

Change-Id: Ief6dc5ff15a83c70ee171774d1bfc6470c0863d1
Closes-bug: 1739108

It is a common practice in *NIX to handle SIGHUP to restart a service
gracefully or reload configurations. This allows the worker to be
reloaded and gives way to future enhancement where we can trigger
journal related tasks externally (ie: full sync, maintenance, etc).

commit_message:
Add SIGHUP handling to journal periodic processing

It is a common practice in *NIX to handle SIGHUP to restart a service
gracefully or reload configurations. This allows the worker to be
reloaded and gives way to future enhancement where we can trigger
journal related tasks externally (ie: full sync, maintenance, etc).

Even though signal handling is setup by neutron-lib, without this patch
SIGHUP is not handled at all by this worker. It just results on a crash
of the process. This patch adds the necessary logic to allow to restart
it without crashing the process.

Change-Id: I4117b3901c7687d86dbf00152fc72b496d7cdbc8

subject: Catch up with horizon framework

is required to get this work.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2017-12-06 00:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2017-12-06 01:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

One minor comment, otherwise this looks great.
Fantastic work!'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-12-06 07:54:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-12-06 07:57:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Done, thanks a lot!
I also spent some time on the uuid stuff.
Looks like it's a responsive design, so if you have a very small screen or large screen, you'll get it displayed unwrapped.
https://pasteboard.co/GWVfAQ2.png
https://pasteboard.co/GWVfMRk.png
https://pasteboard.co/GWVfXMY.png"}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-12-16 10:00:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-12-26 02:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-12-26 02:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Fix merge conflict.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-01-20 01:42:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

don't understand the code but dashboard looks good"}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-01-20 01:48:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

when I created a fish LB with the wizard it didn't show the listener when later clicking on LB and selecting Listener tab."}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-01-20 01:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

to be fair they appear as soon as the LB goes ACTIVE. I think hey should be there right away...'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-20 02:05:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

Looks great to me! Much nicer user experience.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-20 02:11:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

Certificates are showing in the wizard even though the listener is HTTP. I need to figure out which patch broke that.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-01-20 02:58:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@johnsom,
Here I changed the workflow behavior,
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526896/

It used similar handling mechanism of 'Launch Instance' workflow in /dashboard/project/instances/ page."}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-01-20 03:02:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@German, yes, since it creates load balancer and it's decendents one by one, and when the resource is in the middle like pending create state, the children resource can not be created yet.
Also we are currently lacking a auto refresh mechanism, but I plan to add that later as a follow up patch."}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-01-20 03:14:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

different bug'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-01-20 05:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Thanks man!'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-20 06:26:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Catch up with horizon framework

* Use resource registry to reduce boilerplate
* Resolve resources before routing
* Better organization of the page structure

         self._create_admin_user(context, databases=[os_admin_db])

commit_message:
Upgrade Postgresql support to v9.6

Modified existing Postgresql elements to support v9.6.
This change will no longer support pg<9.6, so "wal_log_hints"
is supported by default. Remove "checkpoint_segments" from
config.template because the parameter is no longer supported
from 9.5. By defult, "trovestack kick-start postgresql" will
create a pg-9.6 image. The steps in "30-postgresql" has been
tested in ubuntu trusty. Since yum.postgresql.org is no longer support
fedora-22[1], trovestack use fedora-27 by default, and steps in
"10-postgresql" has been tested too.
Releated commits: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409524/
[1] https://yum.postgresql.org/9.6/fedora/
Closes-bug: 1649084

Change-Id: I65d93635ad45838522abed014825d1f7e567c30c

The inherit segmentation type fails only when parent network has a not
supported network type. In case default is a supported one, e.g. vlan,
then inherit correctly returns vlan as subport segmentation type.

This patch forces to use vxlan as a network type for test validating
inherit option.

from neutron_tempest_plugin

Closes-bug: #1739227

commit_message:
trunk: Create vxlan network when testing inherit

The inherit segmentation type fails only when parent network has a not
supported network type. In case default is a supported one, e.g. vlan,
then inherit correctly returns vlan as subport segmentation type.

This patch forces to use vxlan as a network type for test validating
inherit option.

Cherry-picked from change Idf6935e4da426ff50457483a8f08a9ae3e403f75
from neutron_tempest_plugin

Change-Id: Idf6935e4da426ff50457483a8f08a9ae3e403f75
Closes-bug: #1739227

commit_message:
Fix nested template genearation when attribute path is not string

When determining attributes to cache, we seem to be assuming the
paths to be strings. If there are resource references in outputs
it would be None during validation.

As we've the same code snippet in all group resources
ex. ResourceGroup, ResourceChain and heat AutoScalingGroup, this
fixes it in all those places.

Change-Id: I36d623b183d01632041113f7bff63bf255f5d53c
Closes-Bug: #1719603

commit_message:
Disable security group rule when create port

Use "driver_handles_share_servers=True" backend driver.
When create service neutron port to connect with service instances,
we should set the port security group is disable, to prevent be added
the default security group in neutron. Because some cases the default
security group would lead to the port can not connect with the service
instances.

Change-Id: Ib13e4f80c5a54b2b863b511ebb6e8f82700a3639
Closes-Bug:#1720283

Previously the min lower bound and max upper bound of a ShardRange
were both represented by the empty string. This led to complex
conditional statements. For example:

- when both lower and upper were unbounded then it was not possible to
  simply check that lower != upper

- it was not possible to simply check if one shard range's upper was
  less than another, because the empty string is always less than any
  other string.

Those kinds of tests therefore needed confusing extra logic to first
test if the upper existed at all before making the expected
comparison.

With this patch the min lower and max upper bounds are represented by
singleton objects that have the property that ShardRange.MIN is less
than any other name and ShardRange.MAX is greater than any other
name. Consequently it is now safe to write:

  if sr1.upper > sr2.upper:
      print 'sr1 upper is definitely greater than sr2.upper'

even when sr1.upper is unbounded.

ShardRange.MIN and ShardRange.MAX both use the empty string as their
string representation so they can still be serialized in the same way
as before. Also, ShardRange.lower and ShardRange.upper can still
be set with the empty string but internally this is converted to the
appropriate singleton.

Also, add properties and setters for ShardRange lower and upper
attributes to implement checking.

Change-Id: I00a45b5a29531cb06df28b18e88e38ab6285b5b9

commit_message:
Define singletons to represent min and max shard range bounds

Previously the min lower bound and max upper bound of a ShardRange
were both represented by the empty string. This led to complex
conditional statements. For example:

- when both lower and upper were unbounded then it was not possible to
  simply check that lower != upper

- it was not possible to simply check if one shard range's upper was
  less than another, because the empty string is always less than any
  other string.

Those kinds of tests therefore needed confusing extra logic to first
test if the upper existed at all before making the expected
comparison.

With this patch the min lower and max upper bounds are represented by
singleton objects that have the property that ShardRange.MIN is less
than any other name and ShardRange.MAX is greater than any other
name. Consequently it is now safe to write:

  if sr1.upper > sr2.upper:
      print 'sr1 upper is definitely greater than sr2.upper'

even when sr1.upper is unbounded.

ShardRange.MIN and ShardRange.MAX both use the empty string as their
string representation so they can still be serialized in the same way
as before. Also, ShardRange.lower and ShardRange.upper can still
be set with the empty string but internally this is converted to the
appropriate singleton.

Also, add properties and setters for ShardRange lower and upper
attributes to implement checking.

Change-Id: I00a45b5a29531cb06df28b18e88e38ab6285b5b9

commit_message:
Support function package md5

User can specify md5sum for the package when creating function that
Qinling could check. User can also check by herself when downloading
function package.

Change-Id: Ib3d37cd92bd2ed7018f5a4825a5323b2652948c9
Implements: blueprint qinling-function-package-md5

Introduce SchedulerReportClient.set_traits_for_provider, which accepts a
provider UUID and list of traits to push back to the placement API.  On
success, the local ProviderTree cache is updated appropriately.  On
failure, an exception is raised.  If the failure was a conflict (409),
the exception is a subclass of PlacementAPIConflict (see below) so that
the caller may decide to refresh and retry.

This change also introduces the _ensure_traits helper, which makes sure
a given set of traits exists in the placement service.

Per design [1], we want consumers of SchedulerReportClient to be able to
detect placement API conflict errors (HTTP 409), as distinct from other
errors.  Such consumers (the resource tracker) may respond to conflicts
by redriving the operation in progress, whereas other exceptions will be
allowed to bubble up.  PlacementAPIConflict will be the (base) class of
exceptions raised in response to placement 409s for which we want to
allow this kind of behavior.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_scheduler/2018/nova_scheduler.2018-01-08-14.00.log.html#l-251

commit_message:
SchedulerReportClient.set_traits_for_provider

Introduce SchedulerReportClient.set_traits_for_provider, which accepts a
provider UUID and list of traits to push back to the placement API.  On
success, the local ProviderTree cache is updated appropriately.  On
failure, an exception is raised.  If the failure was a conflict (409),
the exception is a subclass of PlacementAPIConflict (see below) so that
the caller may decide to refresh and retry.

This change also introduces the _ensure_traits helper, which makes sure
a given set of traits exists in the placement service.

Per design [1], we want consumers of SchedulerReportClient to be able to
detect placement API conflict errors (HTTP 409), as distinct from other
errors.  Such consumers (the resource tracker) may respond to conflicts
by redriving the operation in progress, whereas other exceptions will be
allowed to bubble up.  PlacementAPIConflict will be the (base) class of
exceptions raised in response to placement 409s for which we want to
allow this kind of behavior.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_scheduler/2018/nova_scheduler.2018-01-08-14.00.log.html#l-251

Change-Id: I9d9b4a5cb5f6c5d255c00e22923728892c37383f
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
blueprint: ironic-driver-traits

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-01-16 19:22:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm sorry, but I didn't realize that the snapshot operation you were cooking up was on a specific resource provider. I don't see a need for that. Rather, I see a (potential) need for a snapshot/clone of the entire ProviderTree object so that the thing that gets passed to the virt driver update_provider_tree() method can be considered safe for the virt driver to modify (thus the *update* part of "update_provider_tree()").

My thoughts on how all of this would play out were essentially the following:

1) resource tracker asks the reportclient for a clone of the known ProviderTree:

 pt = self.reportclient.provider_tree_snapshot()

2) resource tracker passes this provider tree object to the virt driver's update_provider_tree() method, which returns whether or not it made any changes to the supplied provider tree (add a provider, changed inventory or traits, etc):

 pt_changed = self.driver.update_provider_tree(pt)

3) If the virt driver indicated it made changes to the provider tree, the resource tracker asks the reportclient to commit any changes to the placement API:

 if pt_changed:
     self.reportclient.commit_tree_changes(pt)

4) The reportclient's commit_tree_changes() method would do a few things:

 a) it would grab the deltas between the provider tree parameter and the its local cached ProviderTree object

 b) save those changes to the placement API

 c) update its _provider_tree cached ProviderTree object appropriately

 doing something along the lines of:

  def commit_tree_changes(new_tree):
      with self._provider_tree.lock():
          delta = self._provider_tree.delta(new_tree)
          # delta() would return a namedtuple of something like this:
          # delta_t = namedtuple(['add', 'update', 'deleted'])
          # where 'added', 'updated', and 'deleted' are simply lists of
          # dicts, keyed by resource provider UUID, of the changes to
          # be saved to the placement API.
          for to_add in delta.added:
              # create new resource provider and inventory/traits
          for to_update in delta.updated:
              # update the resource provider's inventory/traits
          for to_delete in delta.deleted
              # delete the resource provider

 note that only self._provider_tree needs to be lock()'d since the "new_tree" parameter was cloned from _provider_tree and owned by the code scope that ran in the resource tracker (and thus was not read by multiple threads).

Hope that makes my thoughts a bit clearer.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-01-16 19:49:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

(1 comment)

@Jay: We're on the same page, barring differences in nomenclature; but we still need (something like) this patch.  Bear with me:

> 1) resource tracker asks the reportclient for a clone of the known ProviderTree:
> 
>  pt = self.reportclient.provider_tree_snapshot()

I called it get_provider_tree.  Implemented here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521098/

You can see it essentially just does a deepcopy of the cached _provider_tree, after making sure said cache is up to date.  (Several of the earlier patches in the series lay the groundwork for allowing us to make sure the cache is up to date.)

It is used here just as you describe:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520246/29/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py@875

> 2) resource tracker passes this provider tree object to the virt driver's update_provider_tree() method, which returns
> whether or not it made any changes to the supplied provider tree (add a provider, changed inventory or traits, etc):
> 
> pt_changed = self.driver.update_provider_tree(pt)

Introduced/documented here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521187/26/nova/virt/driver.py

Consumed here just as you describe:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520246/29/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py@880

> 3) If the virt driver indicated it made changes to the provider tree, the resource tracker asks the reportclient to commit
> any changes to the placement API:
>
> if pt_changed:
>     self.reportclient.commit_tree_changes(pt)

I called it update_from_provider_tree.  Implemented here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533821/

Invoked here just as you describe:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520246/29/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py@883

> 4) The reportclient's commit_tree_changes() method would do a few things:
> 
> a) it would grab the deltas between the provider tree parameter and the its local cached ProviderTree object

Here we need *some* way to get at the guts of each _Provider.  Even if I imlemented a ProviderTree.delta(other_tree) method, that guy would have to get at other_tree.find(rp_uuid).<attributes>.  As we discussed in Monday's scheduler meeting

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_scheduler/2018/nova_scheduler.2018-01-15-14.00.log.html#l-39

we could provide bean-like getters (ProviderTree.get_name_for(name_or_uuid), ProviderTree.get_inventory_for(name_or_uuid), etc.); or we could provide a way to return a (read-only-ish) copy of _Provider as an instance of a public class, so we're no longer violating the nominal privacy boundary of _Provider itself, which is what this patch is doing.

> b) save those changes to the placement API

Again, in order to figure out what the changes (or really, new values) are, we need to be able to get at those values.

> c) update its _provider_tree cached ProviderTree object appropriately

Right, so the report client's _provider_tree cache winds up looking just like the one ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree modified."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-01-16 23:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-01-17 00:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

zvm:recheck'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-01-18 14:45:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > @Jay: We're on the same page, barring differences in nomenclature;
 > but we still need (something like) this patch.  Bear with me:
 > 
 > > 1) resource tracker asks the reportclient for a clone of the
 > known ProviderTree:
 > >
 > >  pt = self.reportclient.provider_tree_snapshot()
 > 
 > I called it get_provider_tree.  Implemented here:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521098/
 > 
 > You can see it essentially just does a deepcopy of the cached
 > _provider_tree, after making sure said cache is up to date. 
 > (Several of the earlier patches in the series lay the groundwork
 > for allowing us to make sure the cache is up to date.)
 > 
 > It is used here just as you describe:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520246/29/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py@875

My issue with the proposed implementation of get_provider_tree() is that it accepts parameters. I don't believe it should. It should essentially just return a deep-copy of the reportclient's cached _provider_tree object.

 > > 2) resource tracker passes this provider tree object to the virt
 > driver's update_provider_tree() method, which returns
 > > whether or not it made any changes to the supplied provider tree
 > (add a provider, changed inventory or traits, etc):
 > >
 > > pt_changed = self.driver.update_provider_tree(pt)
 > 
 > Introduced/documented here:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521187/26/nova/virt/driver.py

ack. Added a -1 on that patch about not needing the extra nodename parameter, but I see we're on almost the same page there. thanks!

 > Consumed here just as you describe:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520246/29/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py@880

Ah, indeed. Ack, looks great besides the comments above about the narrower scope of get_provider_tree() and update_provider_tree() that I'd like to see.

 > > 3) If the virt driver indicated it made changes to the provider
 > tree, the resource tracker asks the reportclient to commit
 > > any changes to the placement API:
 > >
 > > if pt_changed:
 > >     self.reportclient.commit_tree_changes(pt)
 > 
 > I called it update_from_provider_tree.  Implemented here:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533821/

ack. awesomesauce. I'd like to see a generation check done there, but that's exactly the implementation I had in mind. ++

 > Invoked here just as you describe:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520246/29/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py@883

Yup ++

 > > 4) The reportclient's commit_tree_changes() method would do a few
 > things:
 > >
 > > a) it would grab the deltas between the provider tree parameter
 > and the its local cached ProviderTree object
 > 
 > Here we need *some* way to get at the guts of each _Provider.  Even
 > if I imlemented a ProviderTree.delta(other_tree) method, that guy
 > would have to get at other_tree.find(rp_uuid).<attributes>.  As we
 > discussed in Monday's scheduler meeting
 > 
 > http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_scheduler/2018/nova_scheduler.2018-01-15-14.00.log.html#l-39
 > 
 > we could provide bean-like getters (ProviderTree.get_name_for(name_or_uuid),
 > ProviderTree.get_inventory_for(name_or_uuid), etc.); or we could
 > provide a way to return a (read-only-ish) copy of _Provider as an
 > instance of a public class, so we're no longer violating the
 > nominal privacy boundary of _Provider itself, which is what this
 > patch is doing.

See my comment on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533821/. I only believe a single bean-like getter to the provider generation is necessary. I don't believe separate attribute getters are going to be necessary.

 > > b) save those changes to the placement API
 > 
 > Again, in order to figure out what the changes (or really, new
 > values) are, we need to be able to get at those values.

Right, it's the (new) values that we want to get at, not the changes. Therefore, I'd like to propose two things for THIS particular patch:

1) Rename snapshot() to data() -- for reasoning on this, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533821/. Basically, we just want to return the data for the provider. We don't want to copy anything and snapshot implies some level of copying...

2) Return a dict, not an object copy. Simply dump the data, in dict format, back to the caller.

 > > c) update its _provider_tree cached ProviderTree object
 > appropriately
 > 
 > Right, so the report client's _provider_tree cache winds up looking
 > just like the one ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree modified.

ack, and I see that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533821/ accomplishes this.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-01-18 16:49:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

[{'created': '2018-01-12 17:07:07.000000000', 'message': "WIP: ProviderTree.find => ReadOnlyProvider

_Provider is pretty well locked down.  But in order to be able to
consume ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree and flush changes back to
placement, we really need to be able to get at the internals of the
_Provider.

Enter ReadOnlyProvider, which has all the same attributes as _Provider,
but can't be written.  The new ProviderTree.find method returns a copy
of the found _Provider as a ReadOnlyProvider object.

Change-Id: I832bda86d9a6f9924d28dcdbd7091ed466c19196
"}, {'created': '2018-01-12 23:27:25.000000000', 'message': 'ProviderTree.snapshot => ProviderSnapshot

_Provider is pretty well locked down.  But in order to be able to
consume ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree and flush changes back to
placement, we really need to be able to get at the internals of the
_Provider.

Enter ProviderSnapshot, which has all the same attributes as _Provider,
but whose modification is discouraged in various ways (naming,
documentation, and exceptions attempting to set attributes).  The new
ProviderTree.snapshot method returns a ProviderSnapshot of the found
_Provider.

Change-Id: I832bda86d9a6f9924d28dcdbd7091ed466c19196
'}, {'created': '2018-01-15 16:29:13.000000000', 'message': 'ProviderTree.snapshot => ProviderSnapshot

An instance of ProviderTree is used to cache resource provider
information in the report client.  We will also use a ProviderTree
instance as the input and output of ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree.
We will then need to compare those two and flush any differences back to
the placement API.  Thus, we need a way to access the details of
individual resource providers in a ProviderTree.

Prior to this patch, provider details were hidden behind a private
_Provider class, and only accessible from ProviderTree via methods that
assumed you already knew the thing you were trying to compare against.

Enter ProviderSnapshot, which has all the same attributes as _Provider,
but whose modification is discouraged in various ways (naming,
documentation, and exceptions attempting to set attributes).  The new
ProviderTree.snapshot method returns a ProviderSnapshot of the specified
_Provider.

Change-Id: I832bda86d9a6f9924d28dcdbd7091ed466c19196

commit_message:
ProviderTree.data => ProviderData

An instance of ProviderTree is used to cache resource provider
information in the report client.  We will also use a ProviderTree
instance as the input and output of ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree.
We will then need to compare those two and flush any differences back to
the placement API.  Thus, we need a way to access the details of
individual resource providers in a ProviderTree.

Prior to this patch, provider details were hidden behind a private
_Provider class, and only accessible from ProviderTree via methods that
assumed you already knew the thing you were trying to compare against.

Enter ProviderData, which has all the same attributes as _Provider, but
whose modification is discouraged in various ways (naming,
documentation, and exceptions attempting to set attributes).  The new
ProviderTree.data method returns a ProviderData of the specified
_Provider.

Change-Id: I832bda86d9a6f9924d28dcdbd7091ed466c19196
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

This is similar to how we use reserve_block_device_name
for tagged attach in that we can fail fast in the API if

A later change will build on this to pass the multiattach
flag from the API when a multiattach volume is requested
in a new microversion, similar to how 2.49 works.

commit_message:
Pass multiattach flag to reserve_block_device_name

This is similar to how we use reserve_block_device_name
for tagged attach in that we can fail fast in the API if
trying to attach a multiattach volume to an instance on
a compute host that can't support it, either because the
compute service is too old or the virt driver doesn't
support the multiattach capability yet.

A later change will build on this to pass the multiattach
flag from the API when a multiattach volume is requested
in a new microversion, similar to how 2.49 works.

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: Ieec2bbd8a23c861c89bf9922517fa6a5562f1937

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 18:27:03.000000000', 'message': "Enable multiattach capability

This patch adds the ability to create multiple attachments
for a single volume.  This change requires that a volume
either be created with a special volume-type that includes
extra-specs indicating the requirement for multiattach
capabilities from the backend:
    `extra_specs: {'multiattach': '<is> True'}`

or that an available volume is retyped to the specified
multiattach type.

Note that we do NOT do anything to enforce the volume is
formatted with a shared filesystem!  Attempting to use
this feature with a standard ext4 filesystem will lead to
one or more of your attachments erroring out and being
converted to read only mode.

blueprint: bp/multi-attach-v3-attach

Change-Id: Ic8a8ba2271d6ed672b694d3991dabd46bd9a69f4
"}, {'created': '2018-01-10 18:14:45.000000000', 'message': "Enable multiattach capability

This patch adds the ability to create multiple attachments
for a single volume.  This change requires that a volume
either be created with a special volume-type that includes
extra-specs indicating the requirement for multiattach
capabilities from the backend:
    `extra_specs: {'multiattach': '<is> True'}`

or that an available volume is retyped to the specified
multiattach type.

What the patch does is pretty simple:
1.  On volume create
    Inspect the associated volume-type to see if it includes
    the multiattach capability, if it does and
    scheduling/creation is succesful; then we set the
    multiattach attribute on the volume to True

2.  On volume retype
    We verify that if the retype involves multiattach
    capability that it's allowed  and check policy.

    After retype, again we set/update the multiattach
    attribute of the volume appropriately to match
    the newly specified type.

Note that we do NOT do anything to enforce the volume is
formatted with a shared filesystem!  Attempting to use
this feature with a standard ext4 filesystem will lead to
one or more of your attachments erroring out and being
converted to read only mode.
blueprint: bp/multi-attach-v3-attach

Change-Id: Ic8a8ba2271d6ed672b694d3991dabd46bd9a69f4

multiattach type.

What the patch does is pretty simple:
1.  On volume create
    Inspect the associated volume-type to see if it includes
    the multiattach capability, if it does and
    scheduling/creation is succesful; then we set the
    multiattach attribute on the volume to True

2.  On volume retype
    We verify that if the retype involves multiattach
    capability that it's allowed  and check policy.

    After retype, again we set/update the multiattach
    attribute of the volume appropriately to match
    the newly specified type.

Note that we do NOT do anything to enforce the volume is
formatted with a shared filesystem!  Attempting to use
this feature with a standard ext4 filesystem will lead to
one or more of your attachments erroring out and being
converted to read only mode.
blueprint: bp/multi-attach-v3-attach

Change-Id: Ic8a8ba2271d6ed672b694d3991dabd46bd9a69f4

commit_message:
Enable multiattach capability

This patch adds the ability to create multiple attachments
for a single volume.  This change requires that a volume
either be created with a special volume-type that includes
extra-specs indicating the requirement for multiattach
capabilities from the backend:
    `extra_specs: {'multiattach': '<is> True'}`

or that an available volume is retyped to the specified
multiattach type.

What the patch does is pretty simple:
1.  On volume create
    Inspect the associated volume-type to see if it includes
    the multiattach capability, if it does and
    scheduling/creation is succesful; then we set the
    multiattach attribute on the volume to True

2.  On volume retype
    We verify that if the retype involves multiattach
    capability that it's allowed  and check policy.

    After retype, again we set/update the multiattach
    attribute of the volume appropriately to match
    the newly specified type.

Note that we do NOT do anything to enforce the volume is
formatted with a shared filesystem!  Attempting to use
this feature with a standard ext4 filesystem will lead to
one or more of your attachments erroring out and being
converted to read only mode.

blueprint: bp/multi-attach-v3-attach

Change-Id: Ic8a8ba2271d6ed672b694d3991dabd46bd9a69f4

subject: Correctly set nova_cinder_rbd_inuse in os_nova execution
messages: [{'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-01-19 18:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-19 19:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-01-19 19:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-01-19 22:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 18:57:35.000000000', 'message': 'Correctly set nova_cinder_rbd_inuse in os_nova execution

This line is already present in Pike and master, however it was
omitted by mistake in Ocata. This means that when Cinder uses RBD
backends, but no RBD backend is used for Nova's instance backing,
the ceph_client role will be skipped when deploying the compute host.

When this happens, instances trying to attach volumes will receive
an error stating that the libvirt secret store does not contain the
RBD secret:
"libvirtError: Secret not found: no secret with matching uuid"

By passing this nova_cinder_rbd_inuse boolean to the Nova role based
on the set_fact above in this playbook, ceph_client will deploy the
ceph libraries and secret to the compute host when it is needed
for volume attachments to work.

Change-Id: I4a673c4966e36ccc88392ff9e103da7806248e3c
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly set nova_cinder_rbd_inuse in os_nova execution

This line is already present in Pike and master, however it was
omitted by mistake in Ocata. This means that when Cinder uses RBD
backends, but no RBD backend is used for Nova's instance backing,
the ceph_client role will be skipped when deploying the compute host.

When this happens, instances trying to attach volumes will receive
an error stating that the libvirt secret store does not contain the
RBD secret:
"libvirtError: Secret not found: no secret with matching uuid"

By passing this nova_cinder_rbd_inuse boolean to the Nova role based
on the set_fact above in this playbook, ceph_client will deploy the
ceph libraries and secret to the compute host when it is needed
for volume attachments to work.

Change-Id: I4a673c4966e36ccc88392ff9e103da7806248e3c

commit_message:
Add uuid field in ContainerAction object

In etcd, we use 'uuid' to filter container_action instead of 'id'
field. Updating ContainerAction by adding uuid field to support
container_action etcd api.

Change-Id: I748ed1a892a562ad14cb9921009e989862f7035c

commit_message:
Modify docker network naming schema to fix bug/1734550

This bug occurred because there are two docker networks created to represent
one neutron net.[1]
This patch modify the docker network naming schema in _get_docker_network_name.
project_id is not needed in naming schema, because neutron_net_id is a unique
id over neutron networks and also docker networks.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/zun/+bug/1734550/comments/0

Change-Id: Ib716db77f8fbc0adb8597b9c0c7c82efa921ab05
Closes-Bug: #1734550

[{'created': '2018-01-19 11:18:37.000000000', 'message': 'Empty keystone.conf apache2 vhost

Normally the keystone.conf is removed to make sure the
default configuration provided in the keystone package
for Ubuntu is skipped. This will cause issues when upgrading
the keystone package since the keystone.postinst script when
upgrading will look for that file. [1]

Instead we should make sure this file is empty which will make
sure upgrading the package is possible without manual intervention.

This does not affect gate per se but will act as a guideline on how
it should be used.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/keystone/+bug/1737697

commit_message:
Empty keystone.conf apache2 vhost

Normally the keystone.conf is removed to make sure the
default configuration provided in the keystone package
for Ubuntu is skipped. This will cause issues when upgrading
the keystone package since the keystone.postinst script when
upgrading will look for that file. [1]

Instead we should make sure this file is empty which will make
sure upgrading the package is possible without manual intervention.

This does not affect gate per se but will act as a guideline on how
it should be used.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/keystone/+bug/1737697

Closes-Bug: #1737697
Change-Id: Ia69a11614a1fdd32a4903b47427fe3e6a48f9205

Fix the wrong urls in README.rst

The documentation url should be
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lbaas-dashboard/latest/.
Replace "http" with "https" of source url. Fix the bug tracking.

Change-Id: I349f380c6a3a1084eba12f97bb42e8152292d966
Closes-Bug: #1742022

commit_message:
online_data_migrations: allow passing command line params to migrations

The existing extra_params only works for generic ironic-dbsync arguments
(like --config-file), but not for arguments specific to migrations
(like --max-count).

Change-Id: I693738c8b4f7b99082fca56137af6cbe24c06213
Related-Bug: #1690185

commit_message:
agent extensions: fix conditional detach for multiple attachments

A detach should be honored even if there remains
attachments for the same vpn type.

This simple fix is only a partial fix, because it
introduces bug 1744344.

Change-Id: I6c8a46093fbbf62eff263140a9123b62dee00560
Partial-Bug: 1743574

commit_message:
Add amp_project_name to configure flavor access list

Adds support for adding the project being used by octavia to create
amphora to the amphora flavor's access list.

Change-Id: Iba14098d571f26e15c587b82271f00fd7cdc65d5

On hosts that do not have any containers (ie. computes) network bridges
are not needed and may introduce some unwanted overhead. This

commit_message:
Avoid retrieving IP from a missing bridge

On hosts that do not have any containers (ie. computes) network bridges
are not needed and may introduce some unwanted overhead. This
configuration was possible until Mitaka, but broke with the
dynamic-address-fact.yml tasks in Newton.

This change checks if the bridge actually exists and otherwise uses the
IP configured in the inventory instead.

Change-Id: I23668429a19f00f520ac18c76254e83708778d5a
(cherry picked from commit ea32c3da767d156dc851abd9d2b5121375b760e8)

commit_message:
Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I0a9ddb5a8870cdf81a553229889f00090e90ab0b

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: allow to set the BGP local_pref

With this change, bagpipe-bgp local API supports setting
the BGP LOCAL_PREF that will be used in the route
for a VM interface.

Change-Id: I70921d3fb5fc27fdac60cab728ab6b9d731453d5
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-18 14:05:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix neutron_fwaas_dashboard plugin

Horizon container is not starting because of:

cp: cannot stat '/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/neutron_fwaas_dashboard/enabled/_*[^__].py': No such file or directory

So, this change copies the plugins into
the neutron_fwaas_dashboard python package
directory before they are removed from /usr/share.

Change-Id: Ibb300e0dfcde97135c6dfe536ec945b7839293bd
Related-Bug: 1742947
"}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron_fwaas_dashboard plugin

Horizon container is not starting because of:

cp: cannot stat '/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/neutron_fwaas_dashboard/enabled/_*[^__].py': No such file or directory

So, this change copies the plugins into
the neutron_fwaas_dashboard python package
directory before they are removed from /usr/share.

Change-Id: Ibb300e0dfcde97135c6dfe536ec945b7839293bd
Related-Bug: 1742947

commit_message:
Nova: add spice console

This PS adds spice remote console.
User can choose a console by changing console_kind in values file.
Best practice is to select one or the other to run,
so choosing something other than vnc disables the vnc console.

Change-Id: Ic5d361d5f344b7a078e0c3aeb5f921810101552d

Adds RPC calls for rescue interface

This commit adds RPC calls for rescue interface.
It also adds transitions to/from the rescue-related states.

Change-Id: I12cc8c3b89588394ff10837f05dd6ad5e9b55ee7
Partial-bug: #1526449
Co-Authored-By: Jay Faulkner <jay@jvf.cc>

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

Change-Id: I70e914103d9cea256ab8e3c898f2cea46bc3a621
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
Make whitelist externals os agnostic

The exact path can vary in different operating systems, also this will
eliminate the following warning:
WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv

Change-Id: I4a710922197ecd2dcb7500d93d1a895f88f6905e

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-25 16:50:15.000000000', 'message': "Don't load resource data for list_outputs

This RPC call only generates a list of the outputs defined in the template,
not their values, so don't load the resource data needed to calculate the
output values (which can be very slow).

Also, explicitly pass resolve_value=False instead of relying on the default
argument (which is different for format_stack_output() and
format_stack_outputs()), to reduce future confusion.

Change-Id: I79aae94b6552d465db6707cd4a40cd53ff18455b
Closes-Bug: #1719340
"}]
commit_message:
Don't load resource data for list_outputs

This RPC call only generates a list of the outputs defined in the template,
not their values, so don't load the resource data needed to calculate the
output values (which can be very slow).

Also, explicitly pass resolve_value=False instead of relying on the default
argument (which is different for format_stack_output() and
format_stack_outputs()), to reduce future confusion.

Change-Id: I79aae94b6552d465db6707cd4a40cd53ff18455b
Closes-Bug: #1719340

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

Change-Id: If5b344a5d2282c130ffeb1f012cec3e858901529
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
Support power reset command

Some OpenStack installer such as [1] use power reset when switching
from bootstrap kernel to OS installation kernel. So we'd better
implement this.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/admin/projects/openstack/daisycloud-core

Change-Id: I60df3a31c7600d35d50212538fbfffd22bf7c729
Signed-off-by: Zhijiang Hu <hu.zhiiang@zte.com.cn>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 04:04:47.000000000', 'message': 'Mark multinode job as non-voting

As the mutlinode job is failing and is failing
in ways that cannot currently be easily and cleanly
rectified, we should disable voting for the job until
we are able to fully identify the cause and proper
solution in order to allow the project contributors
to continue to land code and have it reviewed while
we work to resolve the multinode grenade job issues.

Change-Id: If204c7b979baa71b3b9bbb7e79d13741f580ba8b
Related-Bug: #1744139
'}]
commit_message:
Mark multinode job as non-voting

As the mutlinode job is failing and is failing
in ways that cannot currently be easily and cleanly
rectified, we should disable voting for the job until
we are able to fully identify the cause and proper
solution in order to allow the project contributors
to continue to land code and have it reviewed while
we work to resolve the multinode grenade job issues.

Change-Id: If204c7b979baa71b3b9bbb7e79d13741f580ba8b
Related-Bug: #1744139

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

Change-Id: I63efb84603b6503e1f2f171681c6f842a52a9de2
Partial-Bug: #1741634

subject: Add missing capability, breaking volume attachments
messages: [{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-01-19 19:19:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-01-19 19:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nThis issue blocks some of our CIs, merging the fix.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 19:19:30.000000000', 'message': "Add missing capability, breaking volume attachments

A new driver capability has been introduced, specifying if volume
multiattach is supported.

The issue is that our driver doesn't have it yet, so attaching
volumes currently fails with a KeyError:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/647116/

This change adds the missing capability field.

Change-Id: I24a3be98d5b7afd1d56eea9bfca22fbca5c64f42
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing capability, breaking volume attachments

A new driver capability has been introduced, specifying if volume
multiattach is supported.

The issue is that our driver doesn't have it yet, so attaching
volumes currently fails with a KeyError:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/647116/

This change adds the missing capability field.

Change-Id: I24a3be98d5b7afd1d56eea9bfca22fbca5c64f42

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

Change-Id: Ida7378a3502f52e55bcc9e816c2b4cd77292a5dc
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
Configure ansible's verbosity according to command's verbosity

This relates the ansible-playbook's verbosity according to the verbose
level that's passed in to the overcloud deploy command.

Depends-On: If7207428561e9f64950d9e2ac438b94d6556fe0d
Change-Id: I151c19dcc4254956b77ddfef87c2e9e65e524926

commit_message:
We dont support fwaas in Horizon

By default we are enabling a plugin
not supported by default.

Only in pike, in master is already disabled.

Change-Id: I7dd2d840c4f706799673bb85eb81ede275976d29
Related-Bug: 1742947

commit_message:
Restore OVSIntPort interfaces after OVS restarts

There are 2 cases when OVS is restarted
1. Package Upgrade
2. OVS restart invoked by Puppet

Closes-Bug: 1737182
Change-Id: I69f5f80d1e359be72773e2622e1d3e90922d8b3b
(cherry picked from commit a0a1984cd3b3d8dea65ee7b88c1d026dae60077a)

commit_message:
Octavia post deployment mistral wrapper

This mistral workflow is written in order to run octavia post
deployment (ansible based playbook) from the undercloud machine
while deploying overcloud by heat.
The workflow should be triggered by heat engine in a step
which is after completing octavia deployment (currently step 5).

Change-Id: If07ded033be9f44b7c7a7e09214032fa89a02e77

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

Change-Id: I987ef9bd82cac9aa3d5258006094c0390c1b7aa2
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
[WIP] Add network policy

This patch set introduces east-west bound network policy enforcement
for OpenStack-Helm* projects.

                        /\
                       /  |
                       \  o
                   _.-`/`-._
       _         _/         \_         _
      ) `-._   _/  /O\   /O\  \_   _.-` (

[{'created': '2017-12-15 07:48:29.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce rfe-confirmed and rfe-triaged tags

Right now we use Launchpad State "Confirmed" and "Triaged" for
the query to generate the agenda of neutron-drivers meetings.
Unfortunately it's often interfered by the gerrit integration.
E.g. A submission of Closed-Bug patch changes the state to "In Progess".

This patch avoid the issue by tweaking the procedure to use a set of
tags instead.

An altenative would be to teach the gerrit integration about our usage.
Or, move to some other systems like storyboard.
But they would require more efforts than this change.

commit_message:
Introduce rfe-confirmed and rfe-triaged tags

Right now we use Launchpad State "Confirmed" and "Triaged" for
the query to generate the agenda of neutron-drivers meetings.
Unfortunately it's often interfered by the gerrit integration.
E.g. A submission of Closed-Bug patch changes the state to "In Progess".

This patch avoids the issue by tweaking the procedure to use a set of
tags instead.

An altenative would be to teach the gerrit integration about our usage.
Or, move to some other systems like storyboard.
But they would require more efforts than this change.

Change-Id: I9becc8052b80a284a4cb336e2da115d28d501720

I think we need to also parse config from tempest as we use them in tempest tests'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-01-18 15:04:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

The results also show that it isn't working though. The plugin tests aren't being run for some reason :/

AFAICT the tempest config will load itself when we access it in the plugin, but I guess we'll only find out if we get the tests to run."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-18 19:26:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-19 01:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-19 02:53:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

OK, I see the problem. The plugin is not being found because we're running in a virtualenv, so the fact that it installed by devstack is irrelevant. When you tried you added it as a dependency in test-requirements.txt, which of course is the thing we need to not do IIUC.

We probably need to not run in virtualenv, but I'll try with sitepackages=True just to see if that helps."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-19 03:00:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-01-19 07:17:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

It didn't work at all so I guess we don't have to worry about that :)

ERROR heat_integrationtests [-] Heat Tempest plugin not found
INFO heat_integrationtests [-] Available Tempest plugins: neutron_lbaas, ceilometer_tests

I set the virtualenv to python2.7 because logging stestr seems to have a bug where it fails if you write to stdout during discovery on Python3. But actually it seems to be ok with this logging, which is good because it seems we don't have a choice but to run *everything* (both services and tests) on Python3 for the Python3 gate."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-19 13:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-19 14:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-19 17:37:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Cool, it's working now."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-19 19:31:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Rolled into Ief31dc961bc108e2863119598dfb16581a38e9cf'}]

commit_message:
Combine integration tests and heat-tempest-plugin

Do all the integration tests in a single run, so that we get results
from all of the tests even if one of the Tempest tests fails.

Change-Id: I3b115bb7ef1ba1e92120c2a42189aa61fb154c76
Depends-On: I5e9325766ce166e62c731330c462c030cb1e11fc

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

Change-Id: I48c72d06513bf931d9adf45a6dab14cc0045dca4

commit_message:
Create config for nl03.o.o

Move inap / tripleo-test-cloud-rh1 / vexxhost into nl03.o.o. This is
to help reduce the CPU load our exists nodepool-launchers are having.

Change-Id: I564e85152d5fe6888f88125059b74951a6e2e8ff
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Minimal nodepool-launcher config take 2

nodepool-launcher still needs access to diskimages section, however we
should be able to remove the specific bits to nodepool-builder.

Change-Id: I43ddf4bc0b3f34ad8654763e8b3678304e75c1c7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Implement system scope

This commit introduces the necessary bits in order to get system
scoped tokens from a keystone server.

bp system-scope

Change-Id: I538f2a6cd2b4113910dfdac250c14f17f80051f6

Change-Id: I9a77d42681af4c59e383553a5f3716afc372bedd

commit_message:
Change flush interval for fluentbit

The default flush interval for fluentbit should be set to the
service's default value (5s) rather than flushing the buffer every
second

Change-Id: I9a77d42681af4c59e383553a5f3716afc372bedd

commit_message:
Update Ceph dashboards to use ceph-mgr prometheus module

This updates the ceph dashboards in grafana to use the metrics
provided by the ceph-mgr prometheus module instead of the digital
ocean ceph exporter

Change-Id: I449bc924034f0beabca3c6e8aab17765a706fd50

commit_message:
helm-toolkit prometheus service annotation clean up

This adds checks for the fields in the service annotations for
prometheus, similar to the checks made for the pod annotations.
It also moves prometheus annotations under a prometheus: key
under a top-level monitoring tree to allow for other monitoring
mechanisms independent of the endpoints tree

Change-Id: I4be6d6ad8e74e8ca52bd224ceddad785577bf6c7

commit_message:
Prometheus: Disable prometheus enable-admin-api by default

This disables the Prometheus admin http api by default to fall in
line with the service defaults, as enabling this exposes endpoints
for deleting and modifying time series over http.

Change-Id: I797dce32d625c4c8e927a6b0649dbba0db7f6905

commit_message:
Migrate to override_role for volume module (part 1)

Now that override_role has supplanted switch_role (which has
been deprecated) in [0], the RBAC tests need to switch to use
override_role.

This PS switches to override_role for the volume module. This
PS handles the first 4 modules for volume.

This PS also removes unnecessary indexing into response bodies.

[0] I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I1dbe2b17716c98570faa36da578fd489d9d461df

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Ic2497f23d0c0a9160fc3fe57ccdb78094d499f83
Partial-Bug: #1741634

RabbitMQ: permit multiple deployments within a single namespace

This PS updates the RabbitMQ chart to permit multiple deployments
within a single namespace.

commit_message:
Fix sources-branch-updater and add docs

Problems resolved:

- Errors relating to 'etc' folders which did not exist in the
  target repositories have been eliminated.

- Some repositories were not being excluded from evaluation
  for file/template updates. All appropriate exclusions are
  now implemented.

- If an OSA role repository did not have the required folder
  to copy rootwrap files into, the copy would fail and the
  rootwrap files therefore be left out of the patch.

- When executed on Mac OS X, python2 is not found.

- Documentation is added to describe how to use the script
  to handle periodic SHA bumps.

Change-Id: I628cd2c3156d118c17ca2f90d4ccf0bc5a080bbf

commit_message:
remove _append_null_domain_id decorator

This decorator is only useful when upgrade Keystone form Liberty
to higher release. I don't think any deployments will upgrade
from Liberty to Queens directly. And Liberty is eol already. So
it's safe engouth to remove it.

Change-Id: I891b0d3e87e8c011a2db758fc84dbd4590f78c96

commit_message:
Fix APIException if cinder is not installed

If cinder is not installed, Sahara API validation will return
an APIException with error message "Cinder is not supported".
Test case "test_node_group_templates" throw an exception:
  "saharaclient.api.base.APIException: Cinder is not supported"

Change-Id: Ic54eea43b9de9373320550d2e54cdaa415e1a603

commit_message:
Run shade functional tests on ansible OpenStack PRs

When someone makes a PR to the OpenStack modules in Ansible, we want to
run shade's functional tests. Turn this on.

Depends-On: I93459ffc116f9106d9eb8000a7e5a58bea507308
Change-Id: Ib9350b6a531da1e8effd096e0157c14e4d3a7555

commit_message:
Migrate object_store to resource2/proxy2

This is the last thing we need to migrate before deleting the old
resource/proxy class.

There's a good pile of things related to uploading and downloading we
should port over from the openstack.cloud code. One of them, streaming
the object data, was added here. We can come back around and get all of
the large-object upload code supported.

Adds alias support into _BaseComponent much like prop used to have
because Swift needs it.

Port some of the unittests to requests-mock because it was just easier
to do that. Doing so uncovered some issues with case-sensitivity and
headers. As a result, there are some changes to resource2.Resource to
get case sensitivity sorted out. TODO comments have been left indicating
a few places for further cleanup, but those are internal and
non-essential.

The default value of has_body is changed to False for head calls.
Because. Well. Let's be honest. It's HEAD. There is no body. By
definition.

Change-Id: I8c4f18f78a77149e23b98f78af82b1d25ab7c4cf

commit_message:
Fixes deprecated neutron config option usage

The neutron nova_metadata_ip config option had its name
deprecated replaced with nova_metadata_host. Because of this,
a few unit tests are failing. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I6915e4b3c362cf01fc8377bcfc8f09f00aae0e24

commit_message:
Add tags to plays

Adds various tags to the deploy_steps_playbook output.

- facts: Run fact gathering
- overcloud: Run all plays for overcloud deployment
- pre_deploy_steps: Run deployments that happen pre deploy_steps
- host_prep_steps: Run host_prep_tasks
- deploy_steps: Run deploy_steps
- post_deploy_steps: Run deployments that happen post deploy_steps
- external: Run all external deployments
- external_deploy_steps: Run all external deployments

external and external_deploy_steps are the same for now. However, I kept
them both b/c "external" is the parallel for "overcloud", and
"external_deploy_steps" is the parallel for "deploy_steps".

Also fixes the name of the host_prep_tasks play that was incorrectly
named "Deployment steps".

Change-Id: Ic6579d187035d00edc1f9190f8ebd12d4400d919

- memory used (percentage)
- file system used (percentage)

task: 6099

commit_message:
Designate - Neutron integration

This patchset implements Designate - Neutron integration feature
based on Neutron extension drivers. As a result DNS records can be
automatically created in Designate when Neutron ports or floating
IPs are created.

Closes-Bug: #1704769
Depends-On: I13b2ab39bd1daac13112398762f2be06022594b0
Change-Id: I001507eff6a3342cc77188e0f4087fa4fcc67b95

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-18 20:35:23.000000000', 'message': "Make sure we use config defaults in profile compat code

The compat code to allow creating a Connection from a Profile has a
couple of bugs. First of all it doesn't return the config object it
creates. (whoops) Second, it doesn't build its config kwargs from a base
of the config defaults, so some code in CloudRegion breaks. The second
bug would also exist in from_session, although we haven't seen it in the
field yet.

Change-Id: Ibd0056e6484cfa9a4c8be6a8bc40a0eb2df76977
"}, {'created': '2018-01-18 21:10:45.000000000', 'message': "Make sure we use config defaults in profile compat code

The compat code to allow creating a Connection from a Profile has a
couple of bugs. First of all it doesn't return the config object it
creates. (whoops) Second, it doesn't build its config kwargs from a base
of the config defaults, so some code in CloudRegion breaks. The second
bug would also exist in from_session, although we haven't seen it in the
field yet.

Change-Id: Ibd0056e6484cfa9a4c8be6a8bc40a0eb2df76977
"}, {'created': '2018-01-18 21:58:17.000000000', 'message': "Make sure we use config defaults in profile compat code

The compat code to allow creating a Connection from a Profile has a
couple of bugs. First of all it doesn't return the config object it
creates. (whoops) Second, it doesn't build its config kwargs from a base
of the config defaults, so some code in CloudRegion breaks. The second
bug would also exist in from_session, although we haven't seen it in the
field yet.

Change-Id: Ibd0056e6484cfa9a4c8be6a8bc40a0eb2df76977
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure we use config defaults in profile compat code

The compat code to allow creating a Connection from a Profile has a
couple of bugs. First of all it doesn't return the config object it
creates. (whoops) Second, it doesn't build its config kwargs from a base
of the config defaults, so some code in CloudRegion breaks. The second
bug would also exist in from_session, although we haven't seen it in the
field yet.

Change-Id: Ibd0056e6484cfa9a4c8be6a8bc40a0eb2df76977

commit_message:
Add upgrade to OSC

This change adds database support for the python-openstackclient
project for the upgrade and cluster-upgrade commands.

The trove command upgrade is now:
    openstack database instance upgrade
The trove command cluster-upgrade is now:
    openstack database cluster upgrade

Change-Id: Ic416d476c645fa3c697881fb001d512ed3d25d2b
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Do not assume all protocols in neutron-lib are usable for SG

Tempest is branchless and thus supposed to work against older
deployments.  Also, it's supposed to work against other
implementations, which might not support the same set as
the reference implementation.  Ideally SG can have a way
to discover the set of usable protocols.  But for now,
let's make this conservative a bit.  It might still be too
aggressive because the set of protocols here was taken from
Ocata. (neutron-lib 1.1.0)

Closes-Bug: #1742385
Change-Id: Id67037252aafbacbe43f6af786f30a687321952d

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

Change-Id: Idf8f634bff5b247639a4673e63aef880a5bfa1d6
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
update constraint for os_vif to new release 1.9.0

- This change blacklists os-vif 1.8.0 as it breaks
  compatiblity with kuryr-kubernetes
  (Ie1b65fb29b6abcf77a531404e67c7e60b2183c19)
  and introduces a file handel leak  due to an
  upstream bug in pyroute2
  (https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/pull/443).

Depends-On: Id05ed5dced8ca26800585b98d65c0a12570773e2
Change-Id: I955022a9dc7df8ee0a73155f8ab514bd51ce4004

Update jobs for ansible-role-cloud-launcher

The current documentation for setting up a development environment
currently omits needing many of the basic build tools for each

walking through the steps for setting up a development environment.

libraries needed for running tox and installing dependencies.

commit_message:
Clarify developer docs for contributors

The current documentation for setting up a development environment
currently omits needing many of the basic build tools for each
linux distribution, which for a new install will cause failures when
walking through the steps for setting up a development environment.

This change adds some commands for installing the various build
libraries needed for running tox and installing dependencies.

Change-Id: I072beb9dee35603f207b71908b0bdcd3a48a5208

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 01:07:01.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Skip unnecessary image uploads

This modifies the container image upload to avoid doing an upload when
the destination image already exists and is identical to the source
image.

This is done by doing a skopeo inspect on the source and destination
images and compares their digest hash.

The eventual aim is to make noop uploads fast enough to justify doing
them every time in the main deploy workflow.

Marked as WIP while metrics are collected on how much time is saved.

Change-Id: Ic9422b0ca168b4405cb1973f4e33c91b0f69f02c
Closes-Bug: #1738668
'}, {'created': '2018-01-17 03:15:36.000000000', 'message': "Skip unnecessary image uploads

This modifies the container image upload to avoid doing an upload when
the destination image already exists and is identical to the source
image.

This is done by doing a skopeo inspect on the source and destination
images and compares their digest hash.

In RDO Cloud, a full upload takes around 8 minutes. With this change
and an already populated local registry it takes less than 10 seconds.
The extra 2 skopeo inspect calls per upload doesn't measurably impact
the full upload time.

This makes the upload fast enough to run within the main deploy
workflow on every run (which will take more work because the upload
yaml file needs to be stored in the plan).

Change-Id: Ic9422b0ca168b4405cb1973f4e33c91b0f69f02c
Closes-Bug: #1738668
"}]
commit_message:
Skip unnecessary image uploads

This modifies the container image upload to avoid doing an upload when
the destination image already exists and is identical to the source
image.

This is done by doing a skopeo inspect on the source and destination
images and compares their digest hash.

In RDO Cloud, a full upload takes around 8 minutes. With this change
and an already populated local registry it takes less than 10 seconds.
The extra 2 skopeo inspect calls per upload doesn't measurably impact
the full upload time.

This makes the upload fast enough to run within the main deploy
workflow on every run (which will take more work because the upload
yaml file needs to be stored in the plan).

Change-Id: Ic9422b0ca168b4405cb1973f4e33c91b0f69f02c
Closes-Bug: #1738668

[{'created': '2018-01-16 12:24:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix _port_arg for security rules with icmp/ipv6-icmp aliases

When a security group rule is created with icmp/ipv6-icmp alias such as
protocol number 1(ICMP), 58(ICMPv6) or string icmpv6(legacy name for
ipv6-icmp) as its protocol along with ICMP/ICMPv6 message type
specified, _port_arg will generate a wrong str for iptables/ip6tables.

This commit fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Iae01b9a0da34797a5f061a110f06e18be9bbec5a
Closes-Bug: #1743552
'}, {'created': '2018-01-17 03:53:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix _port_arg for security rules with icmp/ipv6-icmp aliases

When a security group rule is created with icmp/ipv6-icmp alias such as
protocol number 1(ICMP), 58(ICMPv6) or string icmpv6(legacy name for
ipv6-icmp) as its protocol along with ICMP/ICMPv6 message type
specified, _port_arg will generate a wrong str for iptables/ip6tables.

Change-Id: Iae01b9a0da34797a5f061a110f06e18be9bbec5a
Closes-Bug: #1743552
'}]
commit_message:
Fix _port_arg for security rules with icmp/ipv6-icmp aliases

When a security group rule is created with icmp/ipv6-icmp alias such as
protocol number 1(ICMP), 58(ICMPv6) or string icmpv6(legacy name for
ipv6-icmp) as its protocol along with ICMP/ICMPv6 message type
specified, _port_arg will generate a wrong str for iptables/ip6tables.

Change-Id: Iae01b9a0da34797a5f061a110f06e18be9bbec5a
Closes-Bug: #1743552
