(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-01-11 11:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2018-01-11 12:57:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

There are a couple of races which would need to be addressed, but I have a couple of structural issues with the patch.

The first is something dansmith partially called out in an earlier review: we're adding this functionality to _get_guest_xml(). This is really surprising behaviour for this function, and detracts from the readability of the driver. We have 1 other case where we do this: volume connection. It's also a source of surprise and reduces maintainability.

What these 2 have in common is that they both change the configuration of the host for an instance. I would prefer to see us:

* explicitly configure the host
* generate guest xml
* create the domain

Related, we call _get_guest_xml in a bunch of places where this patch isn't passing allocations:

* finish_migration/finish_revert_migration
* _hard_reboot
  * power_on
  * resume_state_on_host_boot
  * reboot
* _get_existing_domain_xml
  * resume (this is fine as long as the instance hasn't shut down)
  * rescue a shutdown instance (is required here for post-rescue recovery)
* rescue (although vgpus not required here)

AFAICT all of these operations will be broken for instances with allocated vgpus. I haven't checked in detail, but I suspect live migration will also get weird because it hasn't re-done the host configuration for the new target host. I'm guessing that it'll end up looking for vgpus it created on the source host, but perhaps live migration can't work anyway.

For cases where the domain is still running, we can safely recreate the list of allocated mdevs from the domain xml. Where the domain isn't running, IIUC we can safely create/allocate new mdevs, but only if we retrieve the original allocations from somewhere. Where we're not doing this above, we're going to end up with instances which are correct, except that they no longer have their allocated vgpu.

Looking forward, we're not cleaning up mdevs. I don't think this is a problem right now when we only support 1 type, but IIUC allocating an mdev of type X can reduce the availability for type Y, right? If that's the case, I think we should consider cleaning up. This wouldn't be an immediate priority, though."}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-01-11 15:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2018-01-11 16:37:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Do you have any idea how you'll address passing allocations in the various places where we don't currently? I'm asking not just because it's obviously user unfriendly if we don't fix those when landing this feature, but also I worry it might inform how you've structured the code already."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-01-11 16:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
libvirt: create vGPU for instance

If an allocation is asking for a VGPU, then libvirt will look at the
available mediated devices and call the sysfs to create one of them if
needed.

Please note I commented in the relnote all the caveats we currently have
with mediated devices in libvirt, but I'll provide some workarounds for
those in the next changes.

Change-Id: Ibf210dd27972fed2651d6c9bd73a0bcf352c8bab
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-support-for-vgpu

commit_message:
Add label to namespaces

This patch set adds label to "kube-system" and "default"
namespaces used for podSelector.

Change-Id: Ia67a0e4d9adf6f5575d74aebf77673aae3660c62
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Make config-download workflow's verbosity configurable

This exposes the 'verbosity' option from the ansible mistral action,
which will allow us to view more verbose outputs from the ansible
playbook's run.

Change-Id: If7207428561e9f64950d9e2ac438b94d6556fe0d

commit_message:
Add ability to list all system role assignments

This commit makes it so users can query the /role_assignments API
with ?scope.system=all.

bp system-scope

Change-Id: I1476c8da8ace1d60a832dfc3197c147e92f63837

[{'created': '2018-01-19 12:08:15.000000000', 'message': "Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

Change-Id: Ia04dc04d29bed66077e6765b0a327dab56a3b0ea
"}]
commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

Change-Id: Ia04dc04d29bed66077e6765b0a327dab56a3b0ea

commit_message:
[envs] Remove credentials base

rally.deployment.credential.Credential class was a temporary workaround
to support multi-platfrom in Rally. It had not be anounced and a better
solution was found (spoiler: rally.env.platform.Platform [1][2]).

While CredentialBuilder was already removed (see [3]), Credential base
left for OpenStack support and some compatibility stuff.

Backward compatible logic can be reworked (and it is what this patch do)
in such way so we can remove th whole rally.deployment module without
breaking anyone.

[1] - Ide95c8b1e8e72293c009f4cd5e430e64eb1dd604
[2] - I83369e899a8b8609a8cd1e77b895d3a1ef8ae3e4
[3] - If7bde619f7c2e99248a071ff18b8084553e1bec0

Change-Id: I98d5c2e0113672b9f280d30f5550413a13f032ee

commit_message:
Partial revert "Revert "Remove diskimages section from nodepool-launchers""

Add back in tox.ini changes to test all versions of nodepool.yaml files.

This reverts partially commit 7c4da0c8b8bc6d3cfb10c77511cbb57cf13a7a0e.

Also, test nodepool master branch instead of deleted feature/zuulv3
branch.

Change-Id: I0b04d251f62efc362a80a7c6fb595e76c4bf3d76

commit_message:
tests: test-galera-upgrades.sh: Drop Ansible verbosity

The upgrade tests are very noisy since Ansible verbosity is set too
high. This makes debugging problems very painful so drop verbosity
by default and let users set it if desired.

Change-Id: I44b7f13f762807946ad9fdf0078e24c4c52b9da1

commit_message:
Fix bugs caused by dependencies update

* Replace es2015 babel preset with env preset
* Fix ModalPanel transition
* Simplify redux-logger configuration
* remove deprecated 'ecmaFeatures' property from .eslintrc

Partial-Bug: 1743722

commit_message:
agent extensions: remove 'static_routes' special casing

With this change, services produce attachment information
as raw as possible. In particular, a service can produce
multiple attachments.

This changes how so-called 'static routes' are handled,
instead of adding a new 'static_routes' key in attachment
information, a service will produce one attachment for
each static route.

This also allows to fix bug 1744241: the 'linuxif' key
provided to bagpipe-bgp when unplugging for an IPVPN with
linuxbridge was wrong. This fix is not in a separate change,
being hard to address without this change.

Closes-Bug: 1744241
Change-Id: I621494372ff91fbb7b8f811134fcb1dafdb915e8

commit_message:
tasks: lxc_apparmor.yml: Allow dnsmasq to access the AIO log directory

Since Id16b1bcd67bf075a8677206a205ece010e7b014c the Neutron services are
being deployed on baremetal instead of containers. As such, the neutron
logs are now being collected in /openstac/log/$invhostname-neutron/ so
we need to explicitly allow this directory in the dnsmasq apparmor
profile to resolve the following problem:

type=AVC msg=audit(1516203616.761:603129): apparmor="DENIED"
operation="open" profile="/usr/sbin/dnsmasq"
name="/openstack/log/controller00-neutron/neutron-dnsmasq.log" pid=17765
comm="dnsmasq" requested_mask="ac" denied_mask="ac" fsuid=0 ouid=0

Depends-On: Ibe1149ee4fedd2b3d487887e504c500c96165467
Change-Id: I543f69891b2be8bb146f9d3c3b8e0c82811d0e8a

commit_message:
tasks: Manage dnsmasq apparmor profile on supported distros

The Ubuntu apparmor-profiles package may be installed as a dependency
of another package and in that case it will create problems on Neutron
due to the dnsmasq profile. As such, it's best to manage it in a similar
fashion to the SUSE one.

Depends-On: Ibe1149ee4fedd2b3d487887e504c500c96165467
Change-Id: I13b4dcca70f930955e1156cb10817d75a922ae46

We didn't update constraint to 2.21.2 ( revert in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/516076/)   means Glance won't use 2.21.2 and above. The Unit test failed when update constraint in https://review.openstack.org/531788

Maybe I need update the commit message"}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-01-17 12:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:19:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This may break ironic, please hold until John appears.'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-01-17 15:21:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think this is going to break things.

>>> from oslo_serialization import jsonutils
>>> jsonutils.dumps(Exception("help"))
oslo_serialization/jsonutils.py:188: UserWarning: Cannot convert Exception('help',) to primitive, will raise ValueError instead of warning in version 3.0
  "instead of warning in version 3.0" % (value,))
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "oslo_serialization/jsonutils.py", line 209, in dumps
    return json.dumps(obj, default=default, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/json/__init__.py", line 251, in dumps
    sort_keys=sort_keys, **kw).encode(obj)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/json/encoder.py", line 207, in encode
    chunks = self.iterencode(o, _one_shot=True)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/json/encoder.py", line 270, in iterencode
    return _iterencode(o, 0)
ValueError: Circular reference detected
>>>'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-01-17 15:24:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The original patch was a real fix for an issue we were seeing in Ironic and added a work around for here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508225

jsondumps of an Exception is broken without this patch:

>>> from oslo_serialization import jsonutils
>>> thing = Exception("hel")
>>> jsonutils.dumps(thing)
/home/sam/pythonEnv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_serialization/jsonutils.py:188: UserWarning: Cannot convert Exception('hel',) to primitive, will raise ValueError instead of warning in version 3.0
  "instead of warning in version 3.0" % (value,))
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/sam/pythonEnv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_serialization/jsonutils.py", line 209, in dumps
    return json.dumps(obj, default=default, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/json/__init__.py", line 251, in dumps
    sort_keys=sort_keys, **kw).encode(obj)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/json/encoder.py", line 207, in encode
    chunks = self.iterencode(o, _one_shot=True)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/json/encoder.py", line 270, in iterencode
    return _iterencode(o, 0)
ValueError: Circular reference detected'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-01-17 15:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Notes from why this was changed in the first place.

27-Sep-2017 (jlvillal) - Random failures in unit test jobs:
 ironic.tests.unit.common.test_image_service.FileImageServiceTestCase.test_download_hard_link_fail fails

    Python 3.5 fail: http://logs.openstack.org/06/505506/4/check/gate-ironic-python35/2d2bc0c/console.html#_2017-09-27_12_39_12_557894

    Python 2.7 fail: http://logs.openstack.org/42/507942/2/check/gate-ironic-python27-ubuntu-xenial/f6d794b/console.html#_2017-09-27_18_05_14_285319

Seen in both Python 2.7 and Python 3.5 jobs

Occurs on different clouds

Caused by https://github.com/openstack/oslo.serialization/commit/fecad3c31fff10c8c88be64c3c845b840270d00d which added a deprecation warning that also uses os.stat under the covers

One proposed solution avoids the deprecation warning: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508225/

(jlvillal): I have proposed a patch to oslo.serialization which also fixes the issue, but no idea if they will accept it: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508287/

Also even if accepted will take awhile before we can use it as would need a new release of oslo.serialization'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-01-18 03:17:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

please check thread http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126202.html

Maybe one possible solution is to figure out why  the change break Glance's unit test.  which side should be fixed

we also block some version of oslo.serialization in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534739/"}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-01-18 05:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I have a test patch in glance which fixes their issue:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535166/'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:32:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

Given the availability of a Glance fix, and the fact that reverting this will once again break Ironic, I don't think this should go in"}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-01-19 11:46:03.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Revert "When serializing an exception return its 'repr'"

This reverts commit c1a7079c26d27a2e46cca26963d3d9aa040bdbe8.

It breaks Glance's Unit test when updating constraint in [1], For more
detials please refer to [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/531788
[2]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126202.html

Related-Bug: #1728368

Change-Id: Idcec3997e59232f71101c772612df25ab1f48ccf

commit_message:
Refactor quota modules

Split and encapsulate quota and quota_utils modules for better readability.

quota_driver option no longer requires full path to module
for default drivers. To keep it backward compatible, if option is set to
cinder.quota.DriverName it's changed to cinder.quota.driver.DriverName
during QuotaEngine._driver property lazy loading.

Change-Id: Icc9bf6c8b6932f50f5c87012b8eed404b50e8157

[WIP] Quota context manager

To avoid situations where quota rollback is not issued
and generally make code cleaner, this patch proposes
quota reservation context manager.

subject: fix barbican integration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 20988, 'name': 'Mathias Bjoerkqvist', 'email': 'mbj@zurich.ibm.com', 'username': 'mathiasb'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26576, 'name': 'yanpeifei', 'email': 'yanpeifei@gohighsec.com', 'username': 'yanpeifei', 'inactive': True}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2018-01-11 15:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2018-01-11 22:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 20988, 'date': '2018-01-11 22:36:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

For Barbican integration, the port number should also be removed from the 'auth_endpoint = http://keystonehost:5000/v3' example in the overview_encryption.rst doc, I wonder if that would also fit into this patch?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-12 20:57:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

-1 mainly because we should update our soft-dep on castellan around https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.16.0/setup.cfg#L68 to be more like

 castellan>=0.13.0

...since prior to that change auth_url is an invalid kwarg to KeystonePassword.

Do we need to update anything in https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.16.0/etc/keymaster.conf-sample ?

Should we plan on backporting to pike if/when there's a castellan stable release there?

At some point in the not-too-distant future, it'd be nice to have a (non-voting, probably?) barbican-enabled gate job, but I'd say that's out of scope for this fix."}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2018-01-13 19:37:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Tim, thanks for the review.
Definitely agree with adding a non-voting gate job with barbican enabled. I'm leaning towards leaving the option name as is for now. Thoughts??"}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2018-01-13 19:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-15 04:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I understand the wrestle and that you didn't want to break existing usages and keep things stable. But I worry that if we don't support the name change in our middleware that uses castelen then at somepoint it could become a "bug" for someone trying to use Swift, as it doesnt match the castelen api.
Or turn into another place of contention where we (swift) didn't follow along and remained different.

I know we shouldn't cater based on this logic. But maybe we just need to support both? It'll just be an:

  auth_url=conf.get('auth_url', config.get('auth_endpoint'))

Or maybe I'm being to Nit picky :)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-15 17:45:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

I'd take "barbican integration functions again" ahead of "accurately reflects the current state-of-the-art in config options."

But on that note, I probably ought to hold off on +2 until I've actually spun things up and verified that it's all functional...'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-15 22:33:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Happy to be veto'ed. Seems this breaking things, so happy to change my vote."}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:25:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Tim, @Matt, could we compromise to have this patch as is and we move on to add auth_url in a follow-up? 

I'm still hoping that this patch would make into the queens release and then we can make the fine adjustments for next release?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-19 01:43:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(4 comments)

Tested with Barbican 6.0.0.0b1 and Keystone tip-of-master. After some work, I can get encrypted data stored with the Barbican secret!

We could still make this whole process a bit smoother, but having code that's capable of working is a whole lot better than the

 KeyManagerError: Key manager error: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'find'

you'd get without it."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:24:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Thanks for the barbican-swift vagrant env Thiago, it meant I could build up and test.

There was a problem with auth in the env so have pushed a PR that fixed it for me.. but that has nothing to do with this patch.

On current master barbican does indeed fail. This patch does fix it. There are other possible cleanups (like my comments that already exist). But those can always be a follow up.

Fact is there is a problem and we are coming up to a release. So in the face of things my -1 comments are considered NITs that can be discussed in a follow up if need be. So let's get this in.

And just reading Tim's comment, I think we're both on the same page :)"}, {'account_id': 26576, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:35:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > Tested with Barbican 6.0.0.0b1 and Keystone tip-of-master. After
 > some work, I can get encrypted data stored with the Barbican
 > secret!
 > 
 > We could still make this whole process a bit smoother, but having
 > code that's capable of working is a whole lot better than the
 > 
 > KeyManagerError: Key manager error: 'NoneType' object has no
 > attribute 'find'
 > 
 > you'd get without it."}]

commit_message:
fix barbican integration

Added auth_url to the context we pass to castellan
library. In a change [1] intended to deprecate the use
of auth_endpoint passed as the oslo config, it actually
completely removed the use of it[2], so this change became
necessary or the integration is broken.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/483457
[2] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/483457/6/castellan/key_manager/barbican_key_manager.py@143

Change-Id: I933367fa46aa0a3dc9aedf078b1be715bfa8c054

commit_message:
Remove leading and trailing spaces from parameters

Snapshots and backup (create/update) APIs stores 'name' and
description' parameters with leading and trailing spaces in
database after patches [1][2] are merged.

This patch removes leading and trailing whitespaces before
validation and also before storing it in db for 'name' and
'description' parameters.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520991/
[2]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530098/

Closes-Bug: #1742907
Change-Id: Ib5c8d32e2c20cbacebd7b6f7281a44f94a70f7c0

[{'created': '2017-12-28 09:35:03.000000000', 'message': "Do not select inactive l3 agent in L3AgentSchedulerTestJSON

There may be some inactive l3 agents in the system, because the
system won't delete l3 agent records that ever registered,
even if they are no longer valid.

So this is to choose only active l3 agent in resource_setup,
otherwize the testcase will fail unexpectedly because we happened
to choose an inactive l3 agent.

Change-Id: Ie14cafc883c92e791ce866d548e166702bed3d0b
"}, {'created': '2018-01-11 10:39:29.000000000', 'message': "Do not select inactive l3 agent in L3AgentSchedulerTestJSON

There may be some inactive l3 agents in the system, because the
system won't delete l3 agent records that ever registered,
even if they are no longer valid.

So this is to choose only active l3 agent in resource_setup,
otherwize the testcase will fail unexpectedly because we happened
to choose an inactive l3 agent.

Change-Id: Ie14cafc883c92e791ce866d548e166702bed3d0b
"}]
commit_message:
Do not select inactive l3 agent in L3AgentSchedulerTestJSON

There may be some inactive l3 agents in the system, because the
system won't delete l3 agent records that ever registered,
even if they are no longer valid.

So this is to choose only active l3 agent in resource_setup,
otherwize the testcase will fail unexpectedly because we happened
to choose an inactive l3 agent.

Change-Id: Ie14cafc883c92e791ce866d548e166702bed3d0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 16:49:00.000000000', 'message': 'Force ansible to ignore plugins when bootstrapping

When ansible is bootstrapping an environment there can be conflicts with
the ansible plugins we use by default, especially in the case of an
upgrade. This change sets all of the plugin environment variables to
/dev/null so that ansible ignores the existance of all plugins during
the bootstrap process.

Change-Id: I3b03e4c67c589eae528ad6400023c4247a5ca6e6

commit_message:
Force ansible to ignore plugins when bootstrapping

When ansible is bootstrapping an environment there can be conflicts with
the ansible plugins we use by default, especially in the case of an
upgrade. This change sets all of the plugin environment variables to
/dev/null so that ansible ignores the existance of all plugins during
the bootstrap process.

Change-Id: I3b03e4c67c589eae528ad6400023c4247a5ca6e6
Closes-Bug: #1741221
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Thank you for doing this work.  If I understand it correctly, it looks good to me.

To check my understanding: looking at the current Zuul check report for this change, I see both 'legacy-tempest-dsvm-networking-calico' and 'networking-calico-tempest-dsvm'.  Am I correct in thinking that:

- 'legacy-tempest-dsvm-networking-calico' reports the test run that is driven from job definitions in openstack-infra/project-config; but those job definitions will shortly be removed, and so we will stop seeing that job name

- 'networking-calico-tempest-dsvm' reports the test run that is driven by the new job definitions in this repo (specifically .zuul.yaml)."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:12:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

>    'networking-calico-tempest-dsvm' reports the test run that is driven by the new job definitions in this repo (specifically .zuul.yaml).

Yes, exactly. The needed-by references the removal of the job from project-config"}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Move legacy jobs to project

This patch implements first step in zuulv3 migration guide [1]:

Move jobs to networking-calico repo following naming conventions for
Zuul v3 jobs.

Note that we do not need the periodic job
legacy-periodic-tempest-dsvm-networking-calico-master, we can use the
normal job and just run it on master.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#legacy-job-migration-details

Change-Id: I5d008a763168f8db1db1a14051f6f827b152834f
Needed-By: Iaeb11f70d053eeeae3bd6d5e99b6d3b4407a2d4b
Co-Authored-By: Tovin Seven <vinhnt@vn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Basic tempest tests for port associations

Tempest tests for basic validation of L3 BGPVPN
port associations functionality:
- Creation of L3 BGPVPN with port association and route
  type prefix. Update of port association by removal of routes
- Creation of L3 BGPVPN with port association and route
  type prefix. Delete of port association

Related-Bug: 1743574
Change-Id: I2b168c5fc8d137e7a7940b35ae6c9e5c2e95d567

But if we do that, we will also have to check if the L3 service is available to offer BGP VPN router association."}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2018-01-18 14:36:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1

Looks good to me.

I've just a interrogation, should we validate the L3 extension 'extraroute' is supported by the L3 service before proposing that flag?

But if we do that, we will also have to check if the L3 service is available to offer BGP VPN router association."}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-01-18 15:18:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

> Looks good to me.
 > 
 > I've just a interrogation, should we validate the L3 extension
 > 'extraroute' is supported by the L3 service before proposing that
 > flag?
 > 
 > Something like that:
 > 'extraroute' in directory.get_plugin('L3_ROUTER_NAT').supported_extension_aliases

It makes sense to do such a verification.


 > 
 > But if we do that, we will also have to check if the L3 service is
 > available to offer BGP VPN router association.

Such a check is already enforced by the code at
https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/definitions/bgpvpn.py#L188

We can add 'extraroute' to 
https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/definitions/bgpvpn_routes_control.py#L164"}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2018-01-18 15:23:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: Code-Review+2

I don't know we can define that restrictions in API definition file.
So I approve that patch and let you propose a fix on the neutron-lib API definition."}, {'account_id': 2888, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
routes-control: add advertise_extra_routes to router_association

This change adds the DB, service plugin and driver hooks
to implement the new advertise_extra_routes attribute of BGPVPN
router associations.

It also adds the required methods in DB, service plugin
and driver hooks, to allow updating a router_association
resource (which was not previously proposed in the base BGPVPN
API extension).

Change-Id: I58014ea8629c1c613d1bbab1285d6ff5e25aaf9a
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control

commit_message:
Remove message v1 support

This has been marked for deprecation for 9 months and the v1 message
REST api has been deprecated since 2014.

This also updates the message version resource to Resource2.

Change-Id: I623297060fda2c7f44c08f5842d308efb62d4247

subject: Promote castellan's barbican-tempest-plugin job to nv
messages:
[{'account_id': 8623, 'date': '2017-09-28 23:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-09-29 05:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We have moved to Zuul v3 now, this change needs to be done differently now, for current status and more information, see 
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122834.html'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-29 14:13:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We have switched to Zuul v3 now, this change does not apply anymore.

Learn on how to update your change with Zuul v3 at
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html .

Simplified:
* Job definitions can be in-repo; common job definitions are in
  openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs repository
* Job scheduling can be done in-repo for project specific changes,
  common jobs are configured via
  openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml

Read the above mentioned document for finer details.

Please decide whether this change is still needed and then adopt if
for Zuul v3 or abandon it.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-19 11:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

no followup, this does not apply and needs complete rework.

Feel free to restore and update for Zuul 3 if there is interest.'}]
revisions:

The job was experimental, but it seems to be passing when tested,
so let's move it up to non-voting.

Change-Id: Ibb4fff6a889956cabefe82947d034ca97ef8718e
"}]
commit_message:
Promote castellan's barbican-tempest-plugin job to nv

The job was experimental, but it seems to be passing when tested,
so let's move it up to non-voting.

Change-Id: Ibb4fff6a889956cabefe82947d034ca97ef8718e

monasca-agent does not yet work with py35, removing
from projects that get installed for py35 devstack
job.

commit_message:
Use source installtype for pip in images

When making images we can install pip from git rather than distro
packages if we use the source install type. This removes the need for us
to remove the system package for pip then reinstall it from source.

Change-Id: I8215410cdd152323e318f5a77cfeadb87d857bee
Depends-On: Ia5e62b9635af90d81227274a1dd8f20474cdbf73

commit_message:
Add functional test runs for glance

The Glance functional tests used to be run along with the unit tests.
They are now broken out in to their own separate run. This adds two
new jobs for the functional (py27) and functional-py35 test runs.

Change-Id: I2b9506d8cb3f4e7e7fde25b3a8add84b6f1b143b
Depends-on: I93d7216340bef70fc18fc9943da5c740ba3d4761

Let's run the functional tests in both check and gate queues, now
that we have a few successful runs, e.g.:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/452122/

commit_message:
osc-placement: run functional tests in check and gate queues

Let's run the functional tests in both check and gate queues, now
that we have a few successful runs, e.g.:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/452122/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457532/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457533/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457534/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457535/

Note, that test runs above still rely on the fact the following
change to Devstack is merged first:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457636/

Change-Id: Id894176ff8e12736012d8787a3092697685a5f6d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-01-18 02:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-01-18 02:57:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-01-18 09:46:57.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1743863 to bp/nfs-ganesha'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-01-18 11:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-01-18 14:20:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This should work but there's a simpler way to do that I should have noted earlier - in network_data.yaml, just set "vip:false" and this will prevent THT from trying to create VIPs for this network.  You could even roll it into the changes in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512239/.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-01-18 16:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@bfournier: "This should work but there's a simpler way to do that I should have noted earlier - in network_data.yaml, just set "vip:false" and this will prevent THT from trying to create VIPs for this network. You could even roll it into the changes in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512239/."

Yeah, I see that you use that condition but I think that solution would be confusing (as it would be for External network).  We do have VIPs for this network, they just shouldn't be created by the generalized common denominator method.

Do we know for sure that no one else will ever use that field for another purpose where it should really be True if there's a VIP for the network?

That said, I'll set that field to False and add a comment trying to explain why I'm doing so even though there is a VIP if that's the reviewer's consensus.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-01-18 17:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@bfournier: "You could even roll it into the changes in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512239/."

That's probably a good idea whichever way we decide to do it.'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-01-18 17:58:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

As you do still want the VIP for this network, and its just handled differently with ceph creating the VIP in puppet, I think this hardcode change is fine and its OK to leave vip:true in network_data.yaml.  The network data vip setting is also used to create CloudName and fqdn settings.

If you want to roll it into the other patch that's fine, but this seems like the right change."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:56:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Included this fix in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/471245/21'}]

commit_message:
Exclude Storage NFS network from networks hiera

for general VIP definition for keepalived and haproxy.

Recent changes [1] [2] removed hard-coded VIP definitions
for isolated networks in favor of a general definition
for VIPs for services behind an haproxy.

Because the ganesha service on the StorageNFS network currently
has to run active/passive we need to manage its VIP via
pacemaker/corosync to migrate it to the active controller
rather than just running it behind an haproxy.

So exclude this network and VIP from the generalized treatment
of VIPs intended for services that can just run behind an
haproxy.

[1] I117454afe750451ad1f2633fa0f196bb71740b8d
[2] If8d3219a0714e3db34980e884dce84912a837865
Closes-Bug: #1743863

Change-Id: I0e38aed36cad997ae3c25054a0451690e12c8b11

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > > > > > > > > > (1 comment)
 > > > > > > > > >
 > > > > > > > > > > (5 comments)
 > > > > > > > > > Hi Zhao, no, the parameters are necessary.
 > > > > > 'coordination.synchronized'
 > > > > > > > > > decorator can only use the parameters which is
 > passed
 > > > > into
 > > > > > > the
 > > > > > > > > > function it decorates. So we need to pass the
 > > parameter
 > > > > > > > system_id
 > > > > > > > > > and connector['host'] to _do_initialize_connection_locked
 > > > > > if
 > > > > > > we
 > > > > > > > > > want to use it in 'coordination.synchronized'.
 > > > > > > > >
 > > > > > > > > See https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/coordination.py/#L138
 > > > > > > >
 > > > > > > > No, in fact you can use anything as you can, it's just
 > a
 > > > > > string,
 > > > > > > > for variables, they should be accessible in the
 > context,
 > > so
 > > > > > > > self._state['system_id'] and connector['host'] both
 > > should
 > > > be
 > > > > > > fine
 > > > > > > > here.
 > > > > > >
 > > > > > > Actually it does not work. I tried it as following:
 > > > > > > @coordination.synchronized('storwize-host-{connector[host]}')
 > > > > > > def _do_initialize_connection_locked():
 > > > > > > The following error is got:
 > > > > > > ERROR cinder.volume.manager   File "/opt/stack/cinder/cinder/coordination.py",
 > > > > > > line 140, in _synchronized
 > > > > > > ERROR cinder.volume.manager     lock = coordinator.get_lock(lock_name.format(**call_args))
 > > > > > > ERROR cinder.volume.manager KeyError: 'connector'
 > > > > > > The lock_name is storwize-host-{connector[host]} and the
 > > > > > call_args
 > > > > > > is the parameters got from the function.
 > > > > >
 > > > > > Try this:
 > > > > >
 > > > > > @coordination.synchronized('storwize-host' +
 > > self._state['system_id']
 > > > > > + connector['host'])
 > > > > > def _do_initialize_connection_locked():
 > > > >
 > > > > Actually this is not a good choice either especially when the
 > > > host
 > > > > contains special characters such as '{', '}'.
 > lock_name.format(**call_args)
 > > > > will fail once lock_name contains special characters. So we
 > > > change
 > > > > it to this way and the special parameter will be contained in
 > > > > call_args and formatted correctly.
 > > >
 > > > Ok, this makes sense. How about decorate initialize_volume
 > > > directly, instead of returning another function
 > _initialize_volume?
 > >
 > > Hi Zhao, moving the lock decorator from initalize_connection and
 > > terminate_connection to a locking methods _do_initalize_connection_locked
 > > and _do_terminate_connection_locked is to aviod a deadlock issue.
 > > See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/294690/
 > 
 > Thanks for referring that change for me, and another inline comment
 > (this may be my last concern about all these argument things, ;)).

Hi Chao, thanks a lot for your comments.'}, {'account_id': 17045, 'date': '2018-01-18 04:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> run-IBM Storage CI
 > 
 > Looks fine, but still need CI results.

commit_message:
Storwize: use DLM locks

To be able to use Storwize driver with c-vol in A/A deployment,
local file lock should be replaced with distributed lock manager.

Closes-Bug: #1742616
Change-Id: Ib7b5d90b43ba6d004d81ce355db6b853911132be

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I600fa540b45e8dfddb18c36cae778fcddccff705

(3 comments)

If this goes in it *really* needs documentation.  PBR is a little under-documented as is, so adding wrappers like this wants user-facing exposure (i.e. don't have to read the source to figure it out).

I am a little concerned that the original changelog for these wrappers over the standard one was that it was a "simple script" (I1ec46837cea07db514f2fb6338c7bced34a83c4a).  this seems to becoming rather not true...'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:39:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I like the idea but I'm not sure if this is the way to go about it. There are multiple existing solutions for this, like cProfile, which are more than happy to call an existing script for you. In addition, there are open issues and a call for docs which have been unaddressed since this was originally proposed. As a result, I'm going to abandon this. Feel free to pick it up again if you want to."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:39:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add memory tracer argument

Given the latest concern about the memory consumption in OpenStack
services[1], it's necessary to add mechanims to trace memory
increments as possible failures. This patch adds an extra
argument(--mem-trace) in all the generated console scripts.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/111413.html

Change-Id: I935418e7cf63d525b43bb7c2f02fcc151652956c

commit_message:
vars: Drop galera_percona_xtrabackup_repo_url variable

This variable was only used on Ubuntu distributions to select the
upstream Percona repository. There is not much point in having this
configurable so simply hardcode the upstream url to the repository
information and drop the variable.

Change-Id: I12088bd52ab3c392913385001fb71555e101ef56

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated ceilometer-collector group

ceilometer-collector service has been remove from kolla, the
ceilometer-collector group is unnecessary for inventory, this patch
to remove it.

Change-Id: Ib71b6819b5d475c7b55a2f4d13788f5c92841e10

commit_message:
Update kolla_internal_fqdn to database_address since it defined in all.yml

through the database_address has beed defined in groups_vars/all.yml, we should
better use it, this way, if we want to use external database, we just need to
redefined in all.yml

refer to https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/group_vars/all.yml#L83
Co-Authored-By: chenqiaomin <chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net>

Change-Id: Ie559301451954e16347ceaabf02f594c5c5cbe56

commit_message:
Resolve CI issues

* update prettier dependency to version which works with npm5
  [MIT] https://github.com/prettier/prettier
* remove favicons-webpack-plugin

* autofix linting errors to make tests pass
* add simple favicon using html-webpack-plugin
* remove unused .gitignore lines

Change-Id: I6b7d1116f522a6a1dd5e8455e85f4db958424e7c
Partial-Bug: 1743722
Closes-Bug: 1743898

calculate the capacity using only RPC.

Change-Id: Ie4c6791bf70df01a66e49cb8ef104e8155c90443

"}, {'created': '2018-01-08 23:20:20.000000000', 'message': "Don't load nested stack in batched ResourceGroup

Previously whenever we did a batched operation on a ResourceGroup, we
loaded the nested stack into memory in the local engine in order to
determine the current capacity. Change to using the GroupInspector class to

Change-Id: Ie4c6791bf70df01a66e49cb8ef104e8155c90443

commit_message:
Don't load nested stack in batched ResourceGroup

Previously whenever we did a batched operation on a ResourceGroup, we
loaded the nested stack into memory in the local engine in order to
determine the current capacity. Change to using the GroupInspector class to
calculate the capacity using only RPC.

Change-Id: Ie4c6791bf70df01a66e49cb8ef104e8155c90443
Partial-Bug: #1731349

subject: We actually require 'mode http'
messages: [{'account_id': 11221, 'date': '2018-01-09 12:26:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-01-17 08:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24759, 'date': '2018-01-19 02:46:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27399, 'date': '2018-01-19 02:53:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-01-19 09:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 12:26:36.000000000', 'message': 'We actually require 'mode http'

So it turns out that without 'mode http' redirects and rewrites
will not happen, and we're relying on it for multiple things.

Switch neutron to use http-tunnel mode instead which seems to work,
we've had no errors in our setup.

See:
https://www.haproxy.org/download/1.5/doc/configuration.txt

Quoute:
" - tunnel        : only the first request and response are processed,
                      everything else is forwarded with no analysis."

Fixes: bba80acc8b78ab3a34d61b3d0b496551e5a9258e
Change-Id: I0d9abe9731fba1e4deb64932e859f991648bb1ec
'}]
commit_message:
We actually require 'mode http'

So it turns out that without 'mode http' redirects and rewrites
will not happen, and we're relying on it for multiple things.

Switch neutron to use http-tunnel mode instead which seems to work,
we've had no errors in our setup.

See:
https://www.haproxy.org/download/1.5/doc/configuration.txt

Quoute:
" - tunnel        : only the first request and response are processed,
                      everything else is forwarded with no analysis."

Fixes: bba80acc8b78ab3a34d61b3d0b496551e5a9258e
Change-Id: I0d9abe9731fba1e4deb64932e859f991648bb1ec

messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-18 19:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-01-18 20:58:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nBetter than the current situation and more akin to the status quo under Zuul 2.x where we only had one persistent job node which was allowed to run the equivalent job.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-01-19 09:31:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-18 19:42:49.000000000', 'message': "Only run one requirements propose post job at a time

We've seen races where two requirements proposal jobs proposed the same
change but with different change-ids. Add a semaphore so that only one
job runs at a time.

Change-Id: If6c5813044518fb788df562a8d73141b8b0b40d1
Example: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534025
"}]
commit_message:
Only run one requirements propose post job at a time

We've seen races where two requirements proposal jobs proposed the same
change but with different change-ids. Add a semaphore so that only one
job runs at a time.

Change-Id: If6c5813044518fb788df562a8d73141b8b0b40d1
Example: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534025

I18n Extra-ATCs for Queens

List of active translators from 2017-07-01 to 2018-01-10
identified by Zanata Stats API.
Full stats under https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/I18nTeam/ATC_statistics#Queens_cycle_.282017-07-01_to_2018-01-10.29

Alex Eng and Patrick Huang are valuable supporter for Zanata
and still on our Extra-ATC list.

only validate projects when the project list is changed

Don't block changes in this repo when project-config settings are
changed.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Officializing First Contact SIG
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 16708, 'name': 'Kendall Nelson', 'display_name': 'Kendall (diablo_rojo)', 'email': 'kennelson11@gmail.com', 'username': 'kjnelson'}, {'_account_id': 17556, 'name': 'Melvin Hillsman', 'email': 'mrhillsman@gmail.com', 'username': 'mrhillsman'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2017-12-27 21:28:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-05 16:30:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-05 16:30:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Small edit to add missing empty line for readability. LGTM'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-05 16:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Since the file is rendered in order, you probably should place First Contact just below FEMDC in alpha order. Meta is last by design.

We could also do that as a subsequent edit.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-01-06 22:31:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-01-10 20:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-11 08:48:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17556, 'date': '2018-01-11 15:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

After discussion with Thierry to help me ask this properly; could the description reinforce or more clearly state any contribution? Personally I hear the word contributor and am inclined to think developer, which is not a negative/bad thing, just a thing. This can be managed within the SIG obviously but someone reading a list of SIG descriptions I think would be forced to ask what a contributor is.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-01-11 20:44:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I think Melvin's point is valid, though I also hope a quick glimpse at https://www.openstack.org/community/ (first link from the SIG's wiki page) makes it clear contribution could be code and documentation, but also through participating in events, helping with user groups, being users and even via financial sponsorship."}, {'account_id': 17556, 'date': '2018-01-11 20:52:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Suggestion: Provide a place and group of people for new contributors to come to for information, advice, tools, and a warm welcome. If you are reading this, yes, you are a contributor, we want to help you succeed.

A little reluctant to suggest a rewrite but maybe something better than what I have can be drafted by an example.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-01-18 19:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-01-18 19:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-01-18 19:30:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I didn't update the mission statement because its on our agenda for the PTG. https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/FC_SIG_Rocky_PTG"}, {'account_id': 17556, 'date': '2018-01-18 19:31:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Cool, thanks for that link.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-19 09:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
DNM: demo making 'required' work on /allocation_candiates

With these changes I can get candidates that are using traits.
Whether it is fully correct or not is unknown

Note that this does nothing with microversions or anything like
that, is just a quick demo hack.

Change-Id: Ia3c301a03a1dc50ebdc7595fb9e5e962d964a1f3
Related-Bug: #1743860

commit_message:
No need to define "_attrs" in Service class

The "_attrs" is an attribute of base.APIResourceWrapper rather
than that of APIDictWrapper. So there's no need to define it in
the Service class which is a subclass of APIDictWrapper

Change-Id: Id1447b9b9963d84ec987cb062c28863400d90966

subject: Add setting for user menu links
messages:
[{'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2017-12-04 02:01:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-04 04:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27386, 'date': '2017-12-04 07:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2017-12-04 21:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2017-12-04 21:57:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It's not clear to me from the bug description: can we change menu links via custom theme?"}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2017-12-04 21:59:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes if the entire user menu file is overridden. Plugins however are unable to override the user menu file.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2017-12-05 16:24:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

IMO, we should be able to customize things like this one via template overriding'}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2017-12-05 21:14:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I agree, however doing that would require changes to how templates are handled by django or how the templates are structured. The files cannot be overridden in a plugin as 'openstack_dashboard' is the main project and templates are always checked for first there."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-15 11:09:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

If you would like to allow a horizon plugin to add a menu to the user menu, I think what we should do is to add a plugin settings.

If it is a request from operators, adding a setting makes some sense.
Even if we add this as a setting, this is about openstack_dashboard, so HORIZON_CONFIG is not an appropriate place. You need to expose a setting via context_processor.py.'}, {'account_id': 23757, 'date': '2017-12-15 11:41:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi,
As an operator, having this as a setting would be very helpful. Right now we have a local patch just to modify the template generating user menu links, but it's quite an ugly solution."}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2017-12-17 20:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-20 19:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2018-01-10 03:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2018-01-10 03:04:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I have decided not to split this up from the RC links and the USER_MENU_LINKS as there is a want to be able to remove both of those links. I have updated the context processor to check for the v2 link, in cases where SHOW_KEYSTONE_V2_RC is false.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-10 06:37:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2018-01-10 23:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-01-10 23:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-11 18:02:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(12 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2018-01-18 23:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2018-01-19 00:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-19 07:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add setting for user menu links

* User menu links can be specified in the settings page
* Defaults to the standard Open RC links (bug and help links are
  not modified in this patch)
* Url, name and icon can all be specified

Change-Id: I3cbcfbf06ede18d468d4c611ad6005cb74f1b284
Closes-Bug: 1736048

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-01-05 10:20:13.000000000', 'message': 'Preserve trailing slash in domain remap

The request path processed through domain remap middleware will always
skip the trailing slash of the path. In conjunction with static web,
this leads to requests like /v1/AUTH_a/c/AUTH_a/c/ because static web
will redirect the caller to an URL with the trailing slash.
This fix will readd the trailing slash, if it was present in the
original request path.
Static web will still redirect to bogus URLs if the trailing slash is
missing, but this fix ensures serving correct request path (as most
browsers will add the trailing slash per default).
In addtion with this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390846/ the
whole chain with cname lookup, domain remap and static web is now even
working with https.

Change-Id: I47ff64c6cad1241abead65509f6caf174e858e0c
Partial-Bug: #1190625
'}, {'created': '2017-01-05 12:33:12.000000000', 'message': 'Preserve trailing slash in domain remap

The request path processed through domain remap middleware will always
skip the trailing slash of the path. In conjunction with static web,
this leads to requests like /v1/AUTH_a/c/AUTH_a/c/ because static web
will redirect the caller to an URL with the trailing slash.
This fix will readd the trailing slash, if it was present in the
original request path.
Static web will still redirect to bogus URLs if the trailing slash is
missing, but this fix ensures serving correct request path (as most
browsers will add the trailing slash per default).
In addtion with this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390846/ the

Change-Id: I47ff64c6cad1241abead65509f6caf174e858e0c

'}]
commit_message:
Preserve trailing slash in domain remap

The request path processed through domain remap middleware will always
skip the trailing slash of the path. In conjunction with static web,
this leads to requests like /v1/AUTH_a/c/AUTH_a/c/ because static web
will redirect the caller to an URL with the trailing slash.
This fix will readd the trailing slash, if it was present in the
original request path.
Static web will still redirect to bogus URLs if the trailing slash is
missing, but this fix ensures serving correct request path (as most
browsers will add the trailing slash per default).
In addtion with this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390846/ the
whole chain with cname lookup, domain remap and static web is now even
working with https.

Change-Id: I47ff64c6cad1241abead65509f6caf174e858e0c
Partial-Bug: #1190625

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

Change-Id: I5b391e06a48148f13e719d41ea1a9525a206274f
Partial-Bug: #1741634

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2017-10-27 07:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-10-27 14:38:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

Hi Shu,

I like this innovative idea and approach. It is a pleasure to see a practical use case of leveraging Zun's service to provision the cloud shell container. I think this will be a useful feature.

There is one thing that I am not sure. If the cloud shell container is provisioned, will it be clean up when the UI is shutdown ? Regardless of the answer, this patch is good enough for me to vote a +2. Thanks Shu."}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2017-10-30 08:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2017-10-30 08:09:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I'd like to discuss how we should/can manage the container later. In my opinion, the container should be left it as running for specified idling minutes/hours, then stopped and deleted after specified hours by Zun compute. Because the connection between Horizon server and browser may closes suddenly, the server side of Zun UI can not do these operations in this case. And then, I'd like to implement according to the decisions."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-10-30 13:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-10-30 13:45:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> I'd like to discuss how we should/can manage the container later.
 > In my opinion, the container should be left it as running for
 > specified idling minutes/hours, then stopped and deleted after
 > specified hours by Zun compute. Because the connection between
 > Horizon server and browser may closes suddenly, the server side of
 > Zun UI can not do these operations in this case. And then, I'd like
 > to implement according to the decisions.

Sure."}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2017-10-31 02:05:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-18 09:48:04.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Add Cloud Shell feature

This patch realizes the Cloud Shell feature as following manner.

1. Add 'Cloud Shell' menu on the top menu bar.
2. When 'Cloud Shell' menu clicked, create console area on
   the bottom of window.
3. If cloud shell container does not exists for the user,
   create the container.
4. If cloud shell container exists, attach the console area
   to the container.
5. Each time when attach to the container, clouds.yaml will be
   exported into the container.
6. Password will be not imported into the container,
   so user should set manually 'OS_PASSWORD' into envirinment
   variables or 'password' into clouds.yaml.

To test, copy file[1] to directory[2], and restart Horizon.

[1] zun_ui/local_settings.d/_0330_cloud_shell_settings.py
[2] horizon/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/

Change-Id: Ia26be196758e5f3617b31750702a6c54436efb93

commit_message:
Add Cloud Shell feature

Screen Shot:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B1UFZO9xX8eweERNX2FWVGRrMXM/view
Short Video:
https://youtu.be/lYt2U7qZG38

This patch realizes the Cloud Shell feature as following manner:

1. Add 'Cloud Shell' menu on the top menu bar.
2. When 'Cloud Shell' menu clicked, create console area on
   the bottom of window.
3. If cloud shell container does not exists for the user,
   create the container.
4. If cloud shell container exists, attach the console area
   to the container.
5. Each time when attach to the container, clouds.yaml will be
   exported into the container.
6. Password will be not imported into the container,
   so user should set manually 'OS_PASSWORD' into envirinment
   variables or 'password' into clouds.yaml.

Change-Id: Ia26be196758e5f3617b31750702a6c54436efb93
Depends-On: Ie4bc4d7302ce80ed9925db4156ff52f928460aca

'}, {'created': '2018-01-12 02:07:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix an issue on context elevation

The issue was introduced by:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531561/
That patch above fixed an issue of creating volumes in a wrong
tenant, but it made the context elevation ineffective. As a result,
some neutron API calls (i.e. port update) was made by a non-admin
context thus failing due to insufficient permission.

This patch fixed it by using get_admin_context instead of
context.elevated().

Closes-Bug: #1742840

commit_message:
Fix an issue on context elevation

The issue was introduced by:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531561/
That patch above fixed an issue of creating volumes in a wrong
tenant, but it made the context elevation ineffective. As a result,
some neutron API calls (i.e. port update) was made by a non-admin
context thus failing due to insufficient permission.

This patch fixed it by using get_admin_context instead of
context.elevated().

Closes-Bug: #1742840
Change-Id: Ia68729b90d059d7d88a00915582453d38420ab24

 > > the following error from ODL
 > >
 > > 2018-01-18 03:51:44,998 | ERROR | tLoopGroup-11-70 |
 > > WebSocketServerHandler | 280 - org.opendaylight.netconf.sal-rest-connector
 > > - 1.5.3.SNAPSHOT | Listener for stream with name
 > 'data-change-event-subscription/neutron:neutron/neutron:ports/datastore=OPERATIONAL/scope=SUBTREE'
 > > was not found. ANy Idea?

It's https://nexus.opendaylight.org/content/repositories/opendaylight-carbon-epel-7-x86_64-devel/org/opendaylight/integration-packaging/opendaylight/6.3.0-0.1.20180108snap438.el7.noarch/opendaylight-6.3.0-0.1.20180108snap438.el7.noarch.rpm"}]

[{'created': '2017-05-17 08:43:31.000000000', 'message': 'Retrive and process port status updates from ODL

This patch utilizes a websocket to receive port
status updates. Ports are initially set to DOWN
and only after a notification is received on the ws
is the port transitioned to ACTIVE.

This patch also adds logic to ensure port status
update logic is employed only if ODL supports it.

commit_message:
Retrieve and process port status updates from ODL

This patch utilizes a websocket to receive port
status updates. Ports are initially set to DOWN
and only after a notification is received on the
ws is the port transitioned to ACTIVE.

This patch also adds logic to ensure port status
update logic is employed only if ODL supports it.

Change-Id: Id315e1085db183d4a8966de833224f220eae0961

commit_message:
Make serial console resizable

This patch makes serial console resizable according to
parent element size like window or div container.

Change-Id: Ie4bc4d7302ce80ed9925db4156ff52f928460aca
Closes-Bug: #1728533
Needed-By: Ia26be196758e5f3617b31750702a6c54436efb93

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated "giturl" option

From openstackdocstheme 1.18.0, valid Git URLs can be retrieved by
openstackdocstheme[1], we do not need giturl option anymore.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/532163

Change-Id: I8e90fb2e18a07e159b911406634ee578e5113cee

Madhuri,

It looks the test cases for adding security group is already missing at containers_shell.py, so it might be a bit unfair to block the merging because of that. I think we can merge this patch with a tech-debt: https://bugs.launchpad.net/zun/+bug/1744134 . What do you think.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-19 03:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow

Cool. Thank you for logging the bug.'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-06 06:18:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix magnum TLS cert generation

TLS enabled k8s cluster are not created if admin_user, admin_password
and admin_tenant_name are not set in [keystone_authtoken] section,
This patch updates the install guide for the same.

Change-Id: Id58bbbda34d52f60c174630400ae469c48a7d115
Closes-Bug: #1717798
Related-Bug: #1670355
(cherry picked from commit 67a48749c78854657fd55e8125a1dcad11b2f67f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix magnum TLS cert generation

TLS enabled k8s cluster are not created if admin_user, admin_password
and admin_tenant_name are not set in [keystone_authtoken] section,
This patch updates the install guide for the same.

Change-Id: Id58bbbda34d52f60c174630400ae469c48a7d115
Closes-Bug: #1717798
Related-Bug: #1670355
(cherry picked from commit 67a48749c78854657fd55e8125a1dcad11b2f67f)

- gate-zun-devstack-dsvm-docker-etcd-nv http://logs.openstack.org/57/432857/2/check/gate-zun-devstack-dsvm-docker-etcd-nv/a722d13/ : SUCCESS in 34m 59s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-02-14 00:15:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

@Wenzhi,

This is an interesting idea. I will raise a discussion about this proposal in the team meeting. One thing I would like to ask is to write down the details of the idea of this patch in the commit message, so that we can discuss based on that.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-02-16 20:47:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I think it is time to make a call for this patch.

Personally, I like the idea, although I guess there might be a few counter case to handle. However, I would like to consider opinions from other reviewers. Suppose there is no opposing point of view, this patch will look good to me after addressing an exception cleanup issue that I commented inline.

Others, what do you think?'}, {'account_id': 16277, 'date': '2017-02-20 08:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 16277, 'date': '2017-02-20 08:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

currently there are only two image end points i.e. pull and image search, i think image search does not need multihost scenario to be handled, i think only image pull need to handle that. So i was thinking why one would use image_pull, 
1. one case may be pre pulling the images on all compute nodes to speed up the container creation, pulling on all nodes so that when containers move from one node to other there is no problem.
2. operator can pull certain images only once and apply the image_pull_policy never so that those images does not get pulled any time. For example operator may wants to pull sandbox image on all nodes at the same time during cluster setup so that all images are identical.

Now to handle all these cases can we implement image_pull_api with fan_out to all nodes?  I am not sure and may be wrong.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-02-20 15:41:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Yes, @Pradeep made good points. I also have a feeling that image_search doesn't need to handle the multi-host scenario since image drivers are supposed to do a research in remote repo (i.e. Docker Hub, Glance)."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-02-21 15:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We discussed the image-pull API in the last team meeting and below is the summary:

* The use case for the pull API is to pre-download docker images (i.e. kubernetes/pause) to *all hosts*.
* It should be an admin-only API.
* Whether Zun needs this API is controversial. It seems it is uncommon to have an API to pull an image into all hosts.

All, any further thoughts on this one?'}, {'account_id': 16277, 'date': '2017-02-21 16:30:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

In addition to @Hongbin's comment we can make give host as input to this API where admin wants to pull the image, if host is not provided image will be pulled on all nodes."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-02-23 04:44:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 12407, 'date': '2017-02-23 05:48:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Pradeep's idea seems good to me. I think either we have a centralized storage for all images or let the admin decide the host on which they want to pull the image. For time being, pulling on all hosts is ok if no host is provided."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-02-26 16:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

All,

Since the image APIs have been discussed in multiple reviews, I created an etherpad to discuss it. It would be great if you can relay your inputs to there:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/zun-image-api .'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:02:05.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}]

commit_message:
Cleanup test-requirements

python-subunit is not used directly anywhere
and it is dependency of both testrepository
and os-testr
(probably was used by some tox wrapper script before)

Change-Id: If582e55f15a63ba333242e10bdca1dae4bdf1b28

commit_message:
Add deprecation warnings to profile

Profile is being replaced by CloudRegion. While compatibility remains
for the next release, it'll be gone by 1.0. Emit deprecation warnings
so that people can work on migrating.

Change-Id: Id58d563f7eaff48fc34b7bfa37851f3a1db8f25a

commit_message:
Use stestr in tox.ini

Like our other projects, we should use stestr now. This helps especially
with being able to run one test at a time locally.

Change-Id: Ic9b139168654930b4f2f0a0477bbb8779b477590

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 09:06:28.000000000', 'message': "Add validation for galera_common grow.

Galera_common create do the validation before _create_instance, but
galera_common grow doesn't validate the flavor, the volume, the nics
before _create_instances. And, grow also cost resources, it should
check_quotas either.

Change-Id: If25c3e66fc6f4ac83e434880d3f3fe66cb1d4fff
"}, {'created': '2017-12-05 02:57:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add validation for galera_common grow.

Currently, galera_common cluster-create do the validation before call
_create_instances. But cluster-grow does not validate it. Add validation
could avoid some risks：
1.Flavor ID, nics NotFound exception. `Instance.create` also check this,
but do this thing before `Instance.create` is better.
2.Flavor, volume, nics of all intances NotEqual exception.
3.Quotas exteed exception. Although `Instance.create` check quotas for
single instance, we should check_quotas for all instances as a unit.

Since there already has a method `_validate_cluster_instances`.
Reuse the method could reduce code redundancy, but the method is not
so "common", unlike cluster-create, there is no num_instances limits for
cluster-grow. So, this patch move "check number of instances" code to
method `create`.

Change-Id: If25c3e66fc6f4ac83e434880d3f3fe66cb1d4fff
'}]
commit_message:
Add validation for galera_common grow.

Currently, galera_common cluster-create do the validation before call
_create_instances. But cluster-grow does not validate it. Add validation
could avoid some risks：
1.Flavor ID, nics NotFound exception. `Instance.create` also check this,
but do this thing before `Instance.create` is better.
2.Flavor, volume, nics of all intances NotEqual exception.
3.Quotas exteed exception. Although `Instance.create` check quotas for
single instance, we should check_quotas for all instances as a unit.

Since there already has a method `_validate_cluster_instances`.
Reuse the method could reduce code redundancy, but the method is not
so "common", unlike cluster-create, there is no num_instances limits for
cluster-grow. So, this patch move "check number of instances" code to
method `create`.

Change-Id: If25c3e66fc6f4ac83e434880d3f3fe66cb1d4fff

We should raise exception when stack not found, if it's not waiting
for create or adopt (which should be the only two possible reason
that stack may not have been created yet).

Change-Id: I6c13ba8ab1b0e312a0932c40f7e9e2b7f92822c3
"}, {'created': '2017-10-18 08:00:47.000000000', 'message': "Raise HTTPNotFound if not in create or adopt

Change-Id: I6c13ba8ab1b0e312a0932c40f7e9e2b7f92822c3
"}]
commit_message:
Raise HTTPNotFound if not in create or adopt

We should raise exception when stack not found, if it's not waiting
for create or adopt (which should be the only two possible reason
that stack may not have been created yet).

Change-Id: I6c13ba8ab1b0e312a0932c40f7e9e2b7f92822c3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 07:09:25.000000000', 'message': "Default to using networks_client in get_tenant_network

Proxy apis to neutron like '/os-networks' are deprecated
in microverion 2.36, and calling to them will get 404 error.
So this is to use networks_client as default in get_tenant_network.

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id33

Change-Id: I0496d2d0c3c9fe29d61124275c7f5cca78729bf2

commit_message:
Default to using neutron networks_client in get_tenant_network

Proxy apis to neutron like '/os-networks' are deprecated in
microverion 2.36, and calling to them will get 404 error.
So this is to use neutron networks_client as default in get_tenant_network.

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id33

Change-Id: I0496d2d0c3c9fe29d61124275c7f5cca78729bf2
